0.title: Female tourist dances on sacred pyramid as locals throw bottles at her in Mexico
0.article_body: A female tourist in Mexico was attacked by locals for climbing a sacred pyramid. In a video shared on social media, the woman is seen dancing on the sacred site as locals threw bottles at her as part of their protest. She was later brought down by a security official present at the site.

1.title: Defending champions France defeat Australia 4-1 in their 2022 FIFA World Cup opener
1.article_body: Defending champions France defeated Australia 4-1 in their 2022 FIFA World Cup opener at Al Janoub Stadium in Al Wakrah. Olivier Giroud scored a brace in the match and equalled Thierry Henry's record for scoring most goals for France (51). Giroud, aged 36 years and 53 days, also became the oldest footballer to play for France in World Cup history.

2.title: Sam Bankman-Fried ran FTX as his 'personal fiefdom', court hears
2.article_body: Bankrupt crypto exchange FTX was run as the "personal fiefdom" of 30-year-old ex-CEO Sam Bankman-Fried, lawyers representing FTX told a US bankruptcy court on Tuesday. They said FTX spent $300 million on real estate in the Bahamas for the use of its executives. "FTX was in the control of...unsophisticated individuals. Some or all of them were compromised," a lawyer said.

3.title: My love for Manchester United will never change: Ronaldo after exit from club
3.article_body: Releasing a statement after Manchester United announced that he will be leaving the club with immediate effect, Portuguese forward Cristiano Ronaldo said, "I love Manchester United and I love the fans, that will never ever change." He added, "However, it feels like the right time for me to seek a new challenge. I wish the team every success."

4.title: Criminal proceedings begin against Imran Khan in Toshakhana case
4.article_body: Criminal proceedings began against former Pakistan Prime Minister Imran Khan on Tuesday in the Toshakhana gifts case. Khan is accused of "deliberately" concealing "his assets relating to Toshakhana gifts retained by him, particularly in years 2018 and 2019". The Toshakhana is a Pakistani government department that stores gifts given to lawmakers and senior officials by foreign governments.

5.title: UK businesses must reduce dependence on cheap labour: Keir Starmer
5.article_body: UK's Opposition Labour Party leader Sir Keir Starmer on Tuesday said businesses in Britain must reduce dependency on cheap, migrant labour. At a business leaders summit, he said more investments should be made to train workers "who are already here". He said firms must put forth a plan on how they intend to develop the skills of British workers.

6.title: Tribals in T'gana hack official to death for opposing felling of trees
6.article_body: A 47-year-old forest official was hacked to death by a group of tribals in Telangana's Bhadradri Kothagudem when he tried to stop them from felling a tree plantation to take up 'podu cultivation'. The official, Chalamala Srinivas Rao, had gone to Bendalapadu area with a team of forest officials. "Tribals resisted and this led to a confrontation," police said.

7.title: Cristiano Ronaldo leaves Manchester United with immediate effect
7.article_body: Cristiano Ronaldo has left Manchester United by mutual agreement with immediate effect, the club announced. This comes after his interview wherein he criticised Manchester United and claimed he's being forced out of the club. "Everyone at Manchester United remains focused on continuing...team’s progress under Erik ten Hag and working together to deliver success on the pitch," the club said.

8.title: Musk asks if his tweets are considered 'work', Twitter users react
8.article_body: Billionaire Elon Musk on Tuesday tweeted, "Wait, if I tweet, does that count as work?" Reacting to this, a Twitter user said, "I'm guessing your Tesla shareholders, who're losing their shirts as [Tesla's] stock continues to make multi-year lows...might not think that you tweeting counts as work." Another user tweeted, "You're promoting your business, so it is work."

9.title: Former Italian cabinet minister Roberto Maroni dies at 67
9.article_body: Former Italian cabinet minister Roberto Maroni died on Tuesday at the age of 67 after a spell of illness. Maroni was a longtime leader of the right-wing Northern League party. Prime Minister Giorgia Meloni said Maroni had served Italy with "good sense and concreteness". Maroni served as the country's interior minister twice (1994-1995 and 2008-2011) and labour minister (2001) once.

10.title: Mexican Navy finds boat loaded with 10 tons of methamphetamines
10.article_body: The Mexican Navy on Tuesday said a patrol team found a shrimp boat loaded with approximately 10 tons of banned drug methamphetamines off its western Pacific coast. The boat was detected last week, said Navy Secretary Jose Rafael Ojeda. When the marine officials approached the vessel, its crew reportedly tried to sink the boat, he said.

11.title: Jadeja unlikely to travel to Bangladesh for Test, ODI series in Dec: Reports
11.article_body: India all-rounder Ravindra Jadeja is reportedly unlikely to travel to Bangladesh for Test and ODI series in December. According to reports, Jadeja, who has been sidelined owing to an injury since this year's Asia Cup, is yet to fully recover. Notably, the Bangladesh tour, which consists of three ODIs and two Tests, will conclude by December 26.

12.title: Haven't seen son in 3 yrs: Mother of absconding Mangaluru blast suspect
12.article_body: The mother of absconding Mangaluru blast suspect Abdul Mateen Taha claimed that she hasn't seen her son in three years since he went missing from Bengaluru. She added that she hasn't seen him since he attained his engineering degree three years ago. His mother also said that if her son has done anything wrong, she wants him to be punished.

13.title: Maoists torch vehicles used for J'khand railway line construction
13.article_body: Maoists on Tuesday set ablaze around a dozen vehicles used for the construction of a railway line in Jharkhand's Latehar district, police said. In October, maoists had shot at three people in a village and asked railway line construction workers to refrain from work until levy was paid. A private construction firm is engaged in laying the 195-km-long railway line.

14.title: Centre approves ₹10,000 crore for constructing 8 lakh houses in UP
14.article_body: The Centre approved ₹10,000 crore for constructing 8 lakh houses in Uttar Pradesh under the Pradhan Mantri Gramin Awas Yojana. According to a government spokesperson, the houses will be ready by March 2024. The spokesperson added that in the last five years, 27 lakh houses have been built under the scheme and 26 lakh were handed over to the beneficiaries.

15.title: 100 Indian pilgrims arrive in Pak for Hindu saint's birth anniversary
15.article_body: Around 100 Indian pilgrims arrived in Pakistan on Tuesday to attend the celebrations of the 314th birth anniversary of Hindu saint Satguru Shadaram Sahib in Sindh province. The pilgrims entered Pakistan via the Wagah border crossing, a Pakistani official said. The pilgrims will visit the historic Shadani Darbar temple, among other holy sites, he added.

16.title: Bank deposits of Kerala college seized for 'cheating parents'
16.article_body: The bank deposits of Dr SM CSI Medical College in Thiruvananthapuram district, Kerala, worth ₹95.25 lakh have been attached under the anti-money laundering law, the Enforcement Directorate (ED) said on Tuesday. The ED alleged the college authorities cheated parents by taking money from them and promising admission to their children. "However, admissions were not given," the ED said.

17.title: Enjoying batting, expressing myself: Suryakumar on 'Player of the Series' award
17.article_body: After winning 'Player of the Series' award in three-match T20I series against New Zealand, India batter Suryakumar Yadav said he's enjoying his batting. "Just going there and expressing myself. Not carrying any baggage out there," he added. Suryakumar scored 124 runs in two innings, which includes a century he scored in second T20I to help India take a 1-0 lead.

18.title: Kejriwal's electricity model is reason for rising unemployment in Delhi: Cong
18.article_body: Congress leader Ajay Maken alleged that CM Arvind Kejriwal's electricity model is the reason for the rising unemployment in Delhi. "Delhi government gives money directly to private companies without audit. Instead of providing ₹14,731 crore as a power subsidy to consumers, it is being given directly to private companies," Maken said. Notably, Delhi civic polls will be held next month.

19.title: Gujarat CM is a 'puppet', can't even change his own peon: Kejriwal
19.article_body: AAP National Convenor Arvind Kejriwal said that Bhupendra Patel is a "puppet Chief Minister" of Gujarat and "doesn't even have the authority to change his own peon". Speaking for AAP's chief ministerial candidate in Gujarat, Isudan Gadhvi, he asked people if they wanted a 'puppet CM' or an educated CM. Kejriwal further said that Gadhvi's heart "beats for the poor".

20.title: LeT terror module busted in J&K, 4 arrested: Police
20.article_body: A Lashkar-e-Taiba (LeT) terror module was busted in Jammu and Kashmir's Bandipora district on Tuesday, police said. Two active terrorists and two of their associates, including a woman, were arrested by security personnel after the operation. A huge cache of arms and ammunition and materials to make an improvised explosive device (IED) were also recovered.

21.title: Amazon summoned by Labour Ministry over alleged violations in layoffs
21.article_body: Labour Ministry has summoned Amazon India's public policy manager on November 23 following a complaint by the employee union Nascent Information Technology Employees Senate (NITES) alleging violation of labour laws. NITES has alleged that Amazon is forcing employees to quit the company and has sought an inquiry. Amazon has confirmed starting layoffs, which could reportedly affect 10,000 employees.

22.title: Some fans want to kill our players: Iran manager Carlos Queiroz
22.article_body: Referring to some Iranian fans criticising their national team players for not singing National Anthem during their 2022 FIFA World Cup opener, Iran manager Carlos Queiroz said, "Whatever [the players] do, whatever they say, [some fans] want to kill them." He added, "The fans who aren't ready to support the team should stay home."

23.title: Aaditya Thackeray to meet Bihar Dy CM Tejashwi Yadav on Wednesday
23.article_body: Shiv Sena (Uddhav Balasaheb Thackeray) leader Aaditya Thackeray will meet Bihar Deputy Chief Minister and RJD leader Tejashwi Yadav in Patna on Wednesday. The Maharashtra MLA will be accompanied by Rajya Sabha MPs Anil Desai, Priyanka Chaturvedi and other leaders. "It'll be a courtesy meeting," the party said. Earlier this year, Bihar CM Nitish Kumar broke ties with the BJP.

24.title: Army ready to execute order to take back PoK: Northern Command chief
24.article_body: Northern Command chief Lieutenant General Upendra Dwivedi said the Indian Army is ready to execute the order to take back Pakistan-occupied Kashmir (PoK). "If (the ceasefire is) broken at any time, we will give them a befitting reply," said L-G Dwivedi. Earlier, Defence Minister Rajnath Singh said all PoK refugees in India will get their land and homes back.

25.title: Hooda hesitated on preferred batting slot, should say 'I'll replace Kohli': Kaif
25.article_body: Mohammad Kaif said India all-rounder Deepak Hooda shouldn't have "hesitated" when he was asked about his preferred batting position ahead of third T20I against New Zealand. "He should say, 'I want to bat higher up the order...want to play in place of KL Rahul. I'll replace Virat Kohli'," added Kaif. Hooda had said I'd like to bat at number five.

26.title: PhonePe raises ₹742 crore from Singapore-based parent: Report
26.article_body: Flipkart-owned digital payments platform PhonePe has reportedly received a fresh capital infusion of about ₹742 crore from its Singapore-registered parent entity PhonePe Pvt Ltd. In a regulatory filing, the Walmart-backed company’s board passed a resolution to allot a total of 3,71,753 equity shares at ₹19,968 apiece. PhonePe also reported a standalone revenue of ₹1,640 crore for FY22.

27.title: India criticises N Korea in UN for missile launch, says 'it impacts peace, security'
27.article_body: India has condemned the launch of the recent intercontinental ballistic missile (ICBM) by the North Korean regime during a UN Security Council (UNSC) meeting. "Proliferation of nuclear & missile technologies is a matter of concern, as they have an adverse impact on peace & security in the region, including on India," said India's Permanent Representative at the UNSC Ruchira Kamboj.

28.title: How many jobs have they given: Tejashwi criticises PM Modi over Rozgar Mela
28.article_body: After PM Narendra Modi distributed 71,056 appointment letters through the 'Rozgar Mela' event, Bihar Deputy CM Tejashwi Yadav asked, "How many jobs are they (BJP government) giving to the people of this country?" The RJD leader added, "Despite providing appointment letters, the BJP-led central government has been unable to provide jobs to the country's youth."

29.title: TRS MLA grabs govt official's collar for inaugurating school before his arrival
29.article_body: A video has surfaced online showing TRS MLA from Telangana's Gadwal, Bandla Krishna Mohan Reddy, grabbing a government official by his collar for inaugurating a school before Reddy arrived for the event. Reddy held the official's collar and pushed him as he was angered by some remark made by the official. He later clarified that he didn't attack anyone deliberately.

30.title: Denied ticket for Gujarat polls, ex-Congress MLA Rathod joins BJP
30.article_body: Former Congress MLA Kaminiba Rathod on Tuesday resigned from the party and joined the BJP in Gujarat. This comes after Congress denied her a ticket for the upcoming Gujarat Assembly elections. Notably, she had also accused Congress of selling tickets for cash. She had claimed that a middleman had sought ₹1 crore from her for a ticket.

31.title: 6 killed, 4 hurt as lorry rams into mini-van in Andhra Pradesh
31.article_body: Six persons were killed after a speeding lorry rammed into a passenger mini-van in Andhra Pradesh's Alluri Sitarama Raju district near the Telangana border on Tuesday. All the victims were from Chhattisgarh and were travelling in the mini-van. They were returning after visiting the Lord Rama temple in Bhadrachalam in Telangana.

32.title: Sunny Deol had a massive ego, didn't return signing amount of incomplete film: Suneel
32.article_body: Suneel Darshan, speaking about his legal feud with actor Sunny Deol that has continued for over 25 years, accused Sunny of having a "massive ego". He had alleged that Sunny left the film 'Ajay' incomplete and refused to shoot the ending. "First, he promised to return the money. Then he said he had no money...he fooled me," said Suneel.

33.title: This is false: Meta on reports of Mark Zuckerberg resigning as CEO next year
33.article_body: Facebook parent company Meta has denied reports that claimed that CEO Mark Zuckerberg will be stepping down from his role next year. "This is false," Meta spokesperson Andy Stone said in a tweet on Tuesday. News website The Leak had reported that Zuckerberg was set to resign in 2023, which briefly sent the company's shares up 1%.

34.title: AAP turned Tihar into Thailand: BJP on Satyendar Jain's massage
34.article_body: BJP National Spokesperson Shehzad Poonawalla alleged that Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal and Deputy CM Manish Sisodia were aware of AAP minister Satyendar Jain getting a massage in jail. "Kejriwal must tell us how Tihar has been transformed into Thailand," said Poonawalla. He added that the AAP was "fooling" people by claiming the massage was "physiotherapy being done by a rapist".

35.title: PM Modi distributing job letters is an election stunt: Congress
35.article_body: Congress president Mallikarjun Kharge on Tuesday said Prime Minister Narendra Modi handing out job letters to youths was an "election stunt". Earlier in the day, PM Modi handed out over 71,000 job letters to youths across the country via video conference. Kharge reminded the BJP government that it had promised 2 crore jobs every year.

36.title: 10 Chadian soldiers killed in Boko Haram attack near Nigeria border
36.article_body: At least 10 soldiers were killed in an attack on a Chadian military unit by Boko Haram militants in the Lake Chad region near the Nigerian border on Tuesday, Chad's government said. Several others were wounded in the attack on the island of Bouka-Toullorom. The Boko Haram insurgency, which erupted in northeast Nigeria in 2009, has killed over 3,50,000 people.

37.title: India among fastest growing Asian economies amid global slowdown: OECD
37.article_body: Organisation for Economic Cooperation and Development (OECD) said India is among the fastest growing economies in Asia amid a global slowdown. OECD added India is set to be the second-fastest growing G20 economy in FY 2022-23 behind Saudi Arabia. "[India's] GDP growth is expected to slow...to 5.7% in FY 2023-24, before reverting to around 7% in FY 2024-25," OECD said.

38.title: Which companies have seen an ex-CEO return to the company besides Disney?
38.article_body: Disney's Bob Iger has returned to the company as CEO less than a year after his retirement. In 2000, Paul Allaire returned as Xerox CEO, and in 2013, AG Lafley returned as P&G's CEO. Steve Jobs returned as Apple's CEO in 1997 after the company was near collapse and remade it into the world's most-valued company by 2011.

39.title: Will miss Akshay Kumar in 'Hera Pheri 3': Suniel Shetty
39.article_body: Suniel Shetty said he was surprised after knowing about Akshay Kumar's exit from 'Hera Pheri 3'. When asked if he'll miss Akshay in the third part, Suniel said, "Of course, I will and that was the intention that Raju, Shyam and Babu Rao should be together." While Suniel plays the role of Shyam, Babu Rao is played by Paresh Rawal.

40.title: We have no fear & nothing to lose, we'll be 100%: Canada football coach
40.article_body: Canada coach John Herdman said the team will head into their 2022 FIFA World Cup match against Belgium with nothing to lose. “It’s exciting times now, the dark clouds have shifted...we will all be 100%,” said Herdman. He added that it had been a great, “gritty and resilient” journey to reach the tournament and there are no “elements” of fear.

41.title: Lewis Hamilton made me push my limits this year: Mercedes F1's Russell
41.article_body: Mercedes F1 driver George Russell said teammate and seven-time world champion Lewis Hamilton made him push his "limits as a driver". "I've learned a huge amount going up against somebody like him in the same car...There is no better reference," he said. Russell added that he has no doubts that Hamilton will be "back to his normal level next year".

42.title: Twitter calls lawsuit over layoffs 'baseless', says it delayed severance pay
42.article_body: Twitter has told a US federal judge that a lawsuit claiming it violated law by laying off thousands of workers without notice is "baseless". Twitter added that it met its legal obligations by informing workers that their last day would be January 4, or after 60 days. The company said the lawsuit had only caused confusion and delayed severance payments.

43.title: JSW Energy seeks shareholders' nod to appoint Parth Jindal as director
43.article_body: JSW Energy has sought shareholders' approval to appoint Parth Jindal as a Director on the company's board. The remote e-voting process for the resolution will start on November 23 and end on December 22. Parth Jindal, the son of the company's Chairman and Managing Director, Sajjan Jindal, was appointed as an additional director with effect from October 28.

44.title: 300 terrorists present in J&K, 160 waiting to enter: Army commander
44.article_body: Northern Command chief Lieutenant General Upendra Dwivedi said around 300 terrorists are currently in J&K, while 160 others are waiting to sneak in from Pakistan. He added that the security situation in the Union Territory has undergone a major change after the abrogation of Article 370. "Today, peace and development have taken the center stage," said Lieutenant General Dwivedi.

45.title: Man jailed for 6 months for letting cows roam on streets in Gujarat
45.article_body: A man has been sentenced to six months in jail for endangering people's lives by letting his cows roam on streets in Gujarat in 2019. Prakash Jairam Desai also received a two-year jail sentence for threatening members of an Amdavad Municipal Corporation team, who had gone to impound the animals. The team had found five animals roaming near Shantipur Chhapra.

46.title: Dog found carrying newborn's body in mouth inside hospital in Jaipur
46.article_body: A dog was found roaming inside the Mahila Chikitsalaya in Rajasthan's Jaipur with a newborn's body clutched in its mouth. Hospital staff took on the dog, forcing it to run away and leave the body behind. "We're unsure if the infant was born inside our hospital," said hospital superintendent Dr Asha Verma. Police have initiated a probe into the matter.

47.title: 135-year-old message in a bottle found under floor of UK home, pics surface
47.article_body: A plumber in UK's Scotland found a message in a whisky bottle, dating back to 1887, underneath the floorboards of a house. The message said, "James Ritchie and John Grieve laid this floor but they did not drink the whisky...Whoever finds this bottle may think our dust is blowing along the road." The home's owner shared pictures of the find.

48.title: 3 policemen injured in stone-pelting during protest in Chhattisgarh
48.article_body: Three policemen were injured when an agitation for a paddy procurement centre turned violent in Chhattisgarh's Gariaband district, an official said on Tuesday. The residents of Kandekela village had been demanding that the paddy procurement centre, located in Bhejipadar, be shifted to their village, he added. Protesters had allegedly pelted stones, following which some vehicles were also damaged.

49.title: Saudi Arabia manager thanks Crown Prince after defeating Argentina 2-1
49.article_body: Saudi Arabia manager Herve Renard thanked Crown Prince Mohammed bin Salman for his support to the team after they beat Argentina 2-1 in a 2022 FIFA World Cup Group C match. "When we met with...Prince, he did not put any pressure on us," said Renard. He added that the team had made "history" and "it will stay" with them forever.

50.title: I'd like to bat at 5, we've legend playing at 3, I've to be realistic: Hooda
50.article_body: When asked about his preferred batting position in Team India, all-rounder Deepak Hooda said, "I'd like to bat at five, we've a legend playing at three...I've to be realistic, I can't get that spot." Batting at number six in second T20I against New Zealand, Deepak Hooda was dismissed for a duck. This was his second consecutive score of 0.

51.title: K'taka Police alert about terror activities: Bommai on Mangaluru blast
51.article_body: Karnataka CM Basavaraj Bommai on Tuesday said that the Karnataka Police are alert about terror activities. "The National Investigation Agency (NIA) has initiated measures to track...movements of terror organisations, be it international or national, which is behind the Mangaluru blast suspect. We've have taken this case...seriously," he said. Police have busted 18 terror sleeper cells, he added.

52.title: BNP Paribas Arbitrage sells Wipro's shares worth ₹186 crore
52.article_body: BNP Paribas Arbitrage on Tuesday offloaded shares of IT company Wipro for ₹185.76 crore through the open market transactions. According to official data with the BSE, BNP Paribas Arbitrage sold 48,00,000 shares of the company in two tranches. Meanwhile, French financial services company Societe Generale acquired the company's shares at ₹387 per piece.

53.title: Saudi Arabia declares national holiday tomorrow to celebrate win over Argentina in FIFA WC
53.article_body: Saudi Arabia's King Salman bin Abdulaziz has declared Wednesday a national holiday to celebrate the country's victory over Argentina in 2022 FIFA World Cup. Saudi Arabia defeated Argentina 2-1 in their opening match on Tuesday. Saudi Arabia scored two goals within five minutes of each other in the second half after trailing 0-1 in the first half.

54.title: May all your dreams come true: Sara on ex-boyfriend Kartik's b'day
54.article_body: Sara Ali Khan took to her Instagram Stories on Tuesday to wish Kartik Aaryan on his birthday. "Happiest birthday @kartikaaryan...Hope this year is all that you've hoped for and may all your dreams continue coming true," she wrote. Sara and Kartik once dated each other and later parted ways, as confirmed by Karan Johar on his show 'Koffee With Karan'.

55.title: Prankster impersonating Macron spoke to Polish Prez after missile mishap
55.article_body: Poland's President Andrzej Duda spoke to a hoax caller after a suspected Ukrainian stray missile hit a Polish village near the Ukrainian border, Duda's office confirmed on Tuesday. Russian comedians Vovan and Lexus have posted a recording of the call on the internet. This was the second instance in recent years where the pranksters managed to get through to Duda.

56.title: Avatar 2 is f*****g expensive, needs to make $2 bn to be profitable: Cameron
56.article_body: Filmmaker James Cameron has said that his upcoming film 'Avatar: The Way of Water' is "very f*****g" expensive. He added that the film will have to be the third or fourth highest-grossing film in the world in order to make a profit. 'Star Wars: The Force Awakens' is the fourth-highest film currently with $2.07 billion.

57.title: FTX has cash balance of $1.24 bn, owes at least $3.1 bn: Filing
57.article_body: Collapsed cryptocurrency exchange FTX and its affiliates have a combined cash balance of $1.24 billion as of November 20, as per its new bankruptcy filing. According to a Bloomberg report, trading firm Alameda Research's cash balance stood at $401 million, while FTX Japan had $171.7 million. FTX had previously said that it owes its 50 biggest creditors nearly $3.1 billion.

58.title: Dubai airport saw more passengers than pre-COVID-19 era: Official
58.article_body: The passenger numbers at the Dubai International Airport (DXB) have surpassed pre-coronavirus pandemic levels in this year's third quarter, said an airport executive. The airport recorded 18.5 million passengers in the third quarter of 2022, which was 17.8 million passengers in 2020's first quarter. Accordingly, the airport's annual forecast has also been revised by another 1 million passengers.

59.title: Adani Enterprises plans to raise $1.8 billion: Report
59.article_body: Adani Enterprises is reportedly planning to raise $1.8 billion via a further public offering or preferential allotment. Gautam Adani's conglomerate is working with advisers on the follow-on issue and could sell the shares as soon as next year. The company's board will meet on November 25 to discuss raising funds, it said in an exchange filing on Tuesday.

60.title: Cinema down South was always much better than Bollywood: Tigmanshu
60.article_body: Filmmaker Tigmanshu Dhulia has said that cinema in South India was "always" better than Bollywood. "Telugu films used to be a bit over the top but Malayalam and Tamil used to be very good. So, was cinema in Bengal," he added. Tigmanshu stated, "Hindi audience lapped cinema when Southern industry started making multi-lingual films."

61.title: Chemicals linked to cancer, diabetes found in sanitary napkins in India: Study
61.article_body: High amounts of harmful chemicals are present in popular sanitary napkins sold in India, a study published in a report titled 'Menstrual Waste 2022' stated. The study by a Delhi-based NGO found phthalates in 10 samples of sanitary napkins available in the market. Exposure to phthalates has been linked to heart and reproductive system disorders, diabetes, and cancers, among others.

62.title: Siraj's pace is an asset, he'll succeed everywhere around the world: Taylor
62.article_body: Ex-New Zealand captain Ross Taylor has said Mohammed Siraj's "pace is an asset" after the India pacer finished as the leading wicket-taker in India-New Zealand T20I series. "You need those bowlers who can bowl 140 plus...he's going to succeed everywhere around the world and not just on wickets that bounce," he added. Siraj took total six wickets in three-match series.

63.title: Indian biologist gets UN's highest honour for saving endangered storks
63.article_body: Wildlife biologist Purnima Devi Barman is among the honourees of the UN Environment Programme's (UNEP) Champions of the Earth award 2022 in the Entrepreneurial Vision category. Barman leads the 'Hargila Army', an all-female grassroots conservation movement dedicated to protecting the Greater Adjutant stork from extinction. "Barman's...conservation work has empowered thousands of women," UNEP said.

64.title: Arittapatti village notified as Tamil Nadu's first biodiversity heritage site
64.article_body: Tamil Nadu government has declared Arittapatti village in Madurai as the state's first biodiversity heritage site. The village is surrounded by a chain of seven barren granite hillocks that act as a watershed and support close to 72 lakes, 200 natural spring pools and three check dams. The village also hosts around 250 bird species, including three flagship raptor species.

65.title: Sushant showed everyone how a TV actor could transition into films: Sharad
65.article_body: Actor Sharad Kelkar said in an interview that late actor Sushant Singh Rajput showed everyone how a TV actor could transition into films. "Hats off to him...he proved it...He set an example for everyone," Sharad added. He further said Sushant did "some excellent work" in television and films. "He always wanted to do...something great, and he achieved that," said Sharad.

66.title: We lost due to 5 minutes of mistakes: Messi on Argentina's loss vs Saudi Arabia
66.article_body: Argentina captain Lionel Messi said he did not expect to start 2022 FIFA World Cup with a loss to Saudi Arabia. "It's a situation that this group of players have never been through...in five minutes of mistakes...we went 1-2 down," he said. Messi added that the Saudi team "did not surprise" as he knew "they could do that".

67.title: Hindu Mahasabha to rename Meerut after Godse if elected to power
67.article_body: Hindu Mahasabha on Tuesday said it will rename Meerut as Nathuram Godse Nagar if its candidate is elected as the Mayor in the upcoming municipal polls. Abhishek Agarwal, Hindu Mahasabha's new chief of Meerut district for the urban body elections, said that the first promise is to make India a "Hindu Rashtra", adding that patriotic candidates will be identified.

68.title: More Aftab-Shraddha too, India needs strict anti-jihad laws: Assam CM
68.article_body: Assam CM Himanta Biswa Sarma on Tuesday said that India needs strict 'anti-jihad' laws while referring to the murder of Shraddha Walkar, who was killed by her live-in partner in Delhi. "When police asked why he brought only Hindu girls, he said he did it because they are emotional," Sarma said, adding that only BJP could end forced religious conversions.

69.title: Zorba, India's first dog to be deployed for tracking down poachers, dies
69.article_body: Zorba, India's first dog to be deployed for tracking down poachers, died in Guwahati, Assam due to old age. The 12-year-old male Belgian Malinois was a member of 'K9', the nation's first dog squad for wildlife crimes. With an 8-year career covering several rhino protection areas in Assam, Zorba was actively engaged in anti-poaching operations.

70.title: One word, Surya: Zaheer on positives for India from T20I series vs NZ
70.article_body: On being asked to pick positives for India in the T20I series against New Zealand, Zaheer Khan said, "One word: Suryakumar Yadav." "The way Surya was batting was too good, destructive...This was the last T20I in...calendar year and he has scored close to 1,200 runs in the whole season," he added. Suryakumar scored 111* and 13 in the three-match series.

71.title: Won't let Pakistan smuggle weapons, drugs into India: Lt Gen Dwivedi
71.article_body: Lieutenant General Upendra Dwivedi on Tuesday said that Pakistan is trying to smuggle pistols, grenades and drugs into India to create small incidents of unrest in the country. "We'll not let [this] happen," the General Officer-Commanding-in-Chief of Northern Command added. He stated that the Indian Army will always be ready to execute government orders like taking back Pakistan-occupied Kashmir.

72.title: 5.86 lakh differently-abled persons in K'taka given UDID cards: Minister
72.article_body: Karnataka Health Minister Dr K Sudhakar on Tuesday said the state has distributed 5.86 lakh Unique Disability Identification Cards (UDID). "Ramanagara district has the highest number of cards distributed, followed by Chikkamagaluru, Bagalkote, Haveri, Uttara Kannada, Belagavi and Mandya districts," Sudhakar said. He further urged people with disabilities to register their names on the UDID portal.

73.title: Law & order in northeast improved after Modi govt came to power: Tripura CM
73.article_body: Tripura CM Manik Saha on Tuesday said that the law and order situation of the northeastern states has improved significantly under the leadership of PM Narendra Modi. "The government has adopted a 'Zero Tolerance' policy to deal with crimes," Saha said. He added that interstate issues have also been resolved with the efforts of the Modi government.

74.title: What records did India break in T20I cricket in 2022?
74.article_body: India played a total of 40 T20Is this year, the most by any team in a calendar year. India recorded most T20I wins in a calendar year (28). Suryakumar Yadav broke the record for slamming most sixes in a calendar year (68). Further, Rohit Sharma broke the record for winning most T20Is as captain in a year (21).

75.title: Today is a sad day: Argentina manager on team's 1-2 loss to Saudi Arabia
75.article_body: Speaking after Argentina's 1-2 loss to 51st-ranked Saudi Arabia in their first match in FIFA World Cup 2022 on Tuesday, Argentina manager Lionel Scaloni stated, "Today is a sad day but as we always say, chin up and keep going." Saudi Arabia scored both their goals in second half after Argentina captain Lionel Messi scored via penalty in the 10th-minute.

76.title: Major UK swimming pool operator cuts opening hours to save energy costs
76.article_body: A major British swimming pool operator has announced a reduction in its opening hours in wake of the high energy bills affecting households and businesses across Europe. Over 200 leisure centres and swimming pools across Britain will remain open for two hours less than usual on certain days to save on heating and lighting costs, said Greenwich Leisure Limited (GLL).

77.title: 5 bacteria types caused 6.8 lakh deaths in India in 2019: Lancet study
77.article_body: Five bacteria types — E. coli, S. pneumoniae, K. pneumoniae, S. aureus and A. baumannii — caused nearly 6.8 lakh deaths in India in 2019, according to a study published in The Lancet journal. E. Coli was the most deadly pathogen, claiming 1.57 lakh lives in India in 2019. Common bacterial infections were linked to one in eight deaths globally.

78.title: I will attend the FIFA World Cup final in Qatar: Varun Dhawan
78.article_body: Actor Varun Dhawan said that he'll be going to Qatar to attend the final of the FIFA World Cup. When asked to choose between Argentina and Brazil, Varun stated, "I hope Brazil gets in over Argentina. Actually, Argentina aur Brazil mereko dono chalega (I don't really mind either of them winning)." The final will be played on December 18.

79.title: I'm in touch with Charu, I send her nice WhatsApp messages: Rajeev Sen
79.article_body: Actor Rajeev Sen shared a video on his YouTube channel where he said that he's in touch with his estranged wife Charu Asopa, adding that he keeps sending her nice WhatsApp messages. "I try to be nice to her...Making her feel that yes, I'm there, even though we are not physically there with each other," he added.

80.title: Telangana forest officer killed in attack by tribals grazing cattle
80.article_body: A forest officer in Telangana died after he was attacked by two men armed with axes while he was trying to evict tribals illegally grazing cattle on forest plantations on Tuesday. Srinivas Rao was the recipient of KVS Babu Gold Medal for forest protection in his range in 2021. CM K Chandrashekar Rao announced an ex-gratia payment of ₹50 lakh.

81.title: Would love to collaborate with Kartik for 'Pyaar Ka...': Divyenndu
81.article_body: Actor Divyenndu has refuted reports stating he'll reunite with actor Kartik Aaryan for 'Pyaar Ka Punchnama 3' and said there have been no talks over it. "But would love to collaborate with Kartik...We all began together so that will always be a team close to my heart," he added. Divyenndu and Kartik made their debut with 'Pyaar Ka Punchnama'.

82.title: India will grow to become $40 trillion economy by 2047: Mukesh Ambani
82.article_body: Reliance Industries Chairman Mukesh Ambani on Tuesday said, "As the Amrit Kaal unfolds, India will witness an unprecedented explosion in economic growth and opportunities." "From a 3 trillion-dollar economy, India will grow to become a 40 trillion-dollar economy by 2047, ranking among the top three economies of the world," Ambani said at the 10th convocation of Pandit Deendayal Energy University.

83.title: Surprised by Congress leaders' praise for Sardar Patel: Amit Shah
83.article_body: Union Home Minister Amit Shah said that he is surprised that Congress leaders are praising Sardar Vallabhbhai Patel and said that they left no stone unturned to insult him. Shah alleged that Congress performed Patel's last rites in an "unceremonious manner". He further said that Congress has started praising Patel only in view of the upcoming Gujarat Assembly elections.

84.title: Iraqi auditors find embezzlement of $2.5 billion of tax income
84.article_body: Around $2.5 billion (3.7 trillion Iraqi dinars) of the Iraqi government's tax income has been embezzled, Iraqi auditors have found. This development, which was first reported by The Guardian, is being viewed as potentially the biggest corruption scam under ex-Prime Minister Mustafa al-Kahdimi. In Transparency International's clean governance index (2021), Iraq ranked 157th out of 180 countries.

85.title: Sabarimala pilgrims can keep coconuts in flight cabin baggage
85.article_body: The Bureau of Civil Aviation Security (BCAS) has allowed Sabarimala pilgrims to carry coconuts in cabin baggage on flights for a limited period of time. Currently, according to rules, coconuts are not permitted in cabin baggage as they are flammable. According to an official, additional security measures and checks have been put in place with regard to this.

86.title: High-ranking Bhutanese monks arrive in India to visit Buddhist sites
86.article_body: A delegation of 24 high-ranking Bhutanese monks arrived in India on Tuesday for a spiritual and academic tour. The monks will meet top Indian officials in Delhi and visit Buddhist holy sites, including Nagarjunakonda in Andhra Pradesh and Buddhavanam in Telangana. The International Buddhist Confederation, which has organised the trip, said the visit will strengthen ties between Bhutan and India.

87.title: SC to hear NIA's plea against bail to Elgar Parishad accused Teltumbde
87.article_body: The Supreme Court agreed to hear the National Investigation Agency's (NIA's) appeal against the bail granted to scholar-activist Anand Teltumbde in the Elgar Parishad case. Taking note of the submissions by Solicitor General Tushar Mehta, CJI DY Chandrachud said that the matter will be heard on Friday. Teltumbde was granted bail by the Bombay High Court on November 18.

88.title: Actors now are insecure, concerned about money they take home: Suniel
88.article_body: Actor Suniel Shetty, speaking about why it is difficult to make two-hero films nowadays, has said that each actor is insecure about themselves. "Each one talks about the amount of money he wants to take home and not about how much money he wants to put into the product," he further added. Suniel will soon feature in 'Hera Pheri 3'.

89.title: Congress leader's daughter abducted from Jaipur vegetable market
89.article_body: A Congress leader's 21-year-old daughter was allegedly abducted by unidentified persons in Jaipur when she had gone to buy vegetables, police said. The Congress leader said that his daughter was on her scooter and had called him to say that some men were chasing her. The girl's scooter was later found abandoned, while the market's vendors remain clueless, said police.

90.title: Man forces woman to engrave his name on her body with blade in UP
90.article_body: A 25-year-old nursing student was arrested on Tuesday for allegedly forcing a 21-year-old woman to write his name on her private parts with a blade and circulating the video on social media. The accused made obscene videos of the victim holding her at knifepoint. He threatened to kill her and her parents if she refused to marry him, reports said.

91.title: Think big, green & digital 3 mantras to make India green energy leader: Ambani
91.article_body: Reliance Industries Chairman Mukesh Ambani shared three mantras to achieve success in the mission of making India a green energy leader. Addressing the convocation of Pandit Deendayal Energy University (PDEU), he said the three mantras were "Think Big", "Think Green" and "Think Digital". Ambani added that green energy "is a goal each one of you should pursue in mission mode".

92.title: Greece rescues boat with hundreds of migrants on board: Coast guard
92.article_body: Greece towed a fishing boat with hundreds of migrants on board to safety after the vessel went adrift off the island of Crete, the Greek Coast Guard informed. According to the Survivors, there were about 400 to 500 people on board, the coast guard said. Two cargo ships, one navy frigate and one tanker also participated in the rescue operation.

93.title: India looks to grow trade with Australia to $45-50 bn in 5 years: Goyal
93.article_body: India expects total bilateral trade with Australia to reach $45-50 billion annually from the current $31 billion over the next 5-6 years, Union Minister Piyush Goyal said. The statement came after the announcement of the Australian parliament passing the Free Trade Agreement with India. According to the Commerce Ministry, India's exports to Australia may increase by $10 billion by 2026-27.

94.title: Yuvraj Singh gets notice as his 'unregistered' Goa villa listed as homestay on Airbnb
94.article_body: Yuvraj Singh got a notice from Goa government for listing his Morjim villa and other properties in the state as homestays on Airbnb, without registering them as such with the relevant authorities. Singh has been asked to appear before the Tourism Department to explain why he shouldn't be punished. The default in registration may lead to a ₹1-lakh fine.

95.title: May you break many stumps: Irfan on Umran Malik's 23rd birthday
95.article_body: Wishing India pacer Umran Malik on his 23rd birthday on Tuesday, Irfan Pathan took to Twitter and wrote, "May you break many stumps." Ex-India pacer Munaf Patel tweeted, "Happy birthday champ. Live long, wishing all success ahead in life." Robin Uthappa said, "Have a super successful year ahead! Looking forward to watching more of you on the big stage!!"

96.title: Saudi Arabia fans do Ronaldo's 'Siu' celebration after win against Argentina, video viral
96.article_body: A video of Saudi Arabia fans outside the Lusail Stadium doing Cristiano Ronaldo's 'Siu' celebration after Saudi Arabia's 2-1 victory against Argentina in a 2022 FIFA World Cup Group C match has gone viral. Saudi Arabia won the match after scoring two goals in the second half. They were trailing 0-1 after the first half.

97.title: Salman Khan's niece Alizeh begins shooting for debut film: Report
97.article_body: Actor Salman Khan's niece Alizeh Agnihotri has reportedly begun shooting for her debut film. As per reports, National Award-winning filmmaker Soumendra Padhi will be directing the film and it will release in 2023. Alizeh is the daughter of Atul and Alvira Agnihotri. Soumendra has worked in projects like 'Budhia Singh: Born to Run' and 'Jamtara'.

98.title: SA20 league brings much-needed rejuvenation to our domestic system: Duminy
98.article_body: Ex-South Africa batter JP Duminy said that the upcoming SA20 league brings much-needed rejuvenation to the country's cricketing domestic system. "The SA20 is an injection into the domestic system which is usually needed in the upliftment...of the cricketing ecosystem," Duminy said. He added, "I think the uniqueness...is...that there are six IPL franchise owners, which is outside of the IPL."

99.title: New bird-like dinosaur fossil with frog remains in stomach discovered in China
99.article_body: A new bird-like dinosaur with the partial skeleton of an ancient frog in the remains of its gut has been unearthed in China. According to researchers, the dinosaur named Daurlong wangi, which lived about 120 million years ago, was a type of mid-sized dromaeosaurid - a group of bird-like predatory dinosaurs. It primarily fed on fish, mammals, and other dinosaurs.

100.title: Iran hits 'terrorist' base in Iraq's Kurdistan Region: Iranian media
100.article_body: Iran's Revolutionary Guards targeted the base of a "separatist terrorist" group in Iraq's autonomous Kurdistan Region with missiles and kamikaze drones on Tuesday, Iran's Tasnim news agency reported. Last week, Iranian rockets and drones hit the headquarters of Iranian Kurdish parties in the region. Tehran accuses Iraq-based Iranian Kurdish groups of fomenting the ongoing unrest in Iran.

101.title: Saudi goalkeeper breaks down after slamming into teammate's head with a flying knee
101.article_body: Saudi Arabia goalkeeper Mohammed Alowais broke down after slamming into his teammate Yasser Alshahrani with a flying knee during their 2022 FIFA World Cup opening match against Argentina. Alshahrani fell down with his head hitting the turf. The match was halted briefly as he received treatment. He was later carried off on stretcher.

102.title: NCLAT stays CCI imposed penalty of ₹169 crore against OYO
102.article_body: The National Company Law Appellate Tribunal (NCLAT) on Tuesday stayed the penalty of ₹168.88 crore imposed by the Competition Commission of India (CCI) upon OYO. An NCLAT Division Bench, however, directed OYO to deposit 10% of the penalty amount. The CCI had levied the penalty on the hospitality and travel tech firm for alleged anti-competitive practices.

103.title: TN BJP suspends actress Gayathri for 6 months for 'violating party discipline'
103.article_body: BJP Tamil Nadu President K Annamalai on Tuesday announced the suspension of actress Gayathri Raghuramm for six months for "repeatedly violating party discipline and bringing disrepute" to it. Annamalai also barred OBC leader Surya Siva from party events after an audio clip of him in which he was purportedly heard using abusive language against a woman colleague went viral.

104.title: Feel blessed to get my 1st 'Player of the Match' award: India pacer Siraj
104.article_body: After being adjudged 'Player of the Match' against New Zealand in third T20I, India pacer Mohammed Siraj took to Twitter and wrote, "Thank you everyone for the wishes." He added, "Feel blessed to get my first 'Player of the Match' award and contribute to the team's [series] win. Onwards and upwards from here." Siraj posted bowling figures of 4-0-17-4.

105.title: I felt attack is best defence on this wicket: Hardik Pandya
105.article_body: After scoring an unbeaten 30(18) against New Zealand, India skipper Hardik Pandya said that he felt attack was the best defence on the pitch at McLean Park on Tuesday. "We know the kind of bowling attacks they (New Zealand) have, it was very important to get those 10-15 runs extra even though we lost a couple of wickets," Pandya said.

106.title: Principal, 3 teachers arrested after Kerala girl sexually assaulted
106.article_body: Kerala Police has arrested a government school teacher from Tamil Nadu for allegedly sexually assaulting a girl student last week. The school's principal and two other teachers were also arrested for not reporting the incident to the police on time. Police have also seized the main accused's car, which he used to evade his arrest after allegedly committing the crime.

107.title: Tim Hortons plans to open around 120 stores in India in 3 years
107.article_body: Canadian restaurant chain Tim Hortons plans to open around 120 stores in India in the next three years at an investment of up to ₹300 crore, the company’s India CEO Navin Gurnaney said. He added that the company will “build the foundation” with 20 new stores in the first year. Gurnaney mentioned that all the stores will be company-owned.

108.title: Kartik Aaryan is so driven and hard-working: 'Freddy' co-star Alaya F
108.article_body: Actress Alaya F, sharing her experience of working with Kartik Aaryan in the upcoming movie 'Freddy', said she learnt a lot from him. "He's so driven and...hard-working," she added. "Seeing him work and working with him validated my core belief that if you're obsessed with your work...nothing can stop you from achieving everything you want and more," Alaya said.

109.title: It is a dream role: Akshay on playing Chhatrapati Shivaji Maharaj
109.article_body: Akshay Kumar, who'll be portraying Chhatrapati Shivaji Maharaj in the upcoming film 'Vedat Marathe Veer Daudale Saat', said he was taken aback when he was offered the role. Calling it a "dream role", the actor said, "It comes with a responsibility." "Also, I'll be working with director Mahesh Manjrekar for...first time and it's going to be an experience," said Akshay.

110.title: Govt invites bids for solar manufacturing under ₹19,500-crore PLI scheme
110.article_body: The state-run Solar Energy Corporation of India is seeking bids from solar manufacturers under the second tranche of the Production Linked Incentive (PLI) scheme with a corpus of ₹19,500 crore. The scheme is aimed at achieving manufacturing capacity of Giga Watt (GW) scale in high efficiency solar photovoltaic (PV) modules. The last date for submitting bids is January 11, 2023.

111.title: India-UAE trade to surpass $88 billion this year
111.article_body: India and UAE have projected to surpass bilateral trade worth $88 billion this year. During the five months between April and August of current fiscal year, the bilateral trade stands at $36.82 billion. UAE signed its first-ever Comprehensive Economic Partnership Agreement agreement with India in February this year. UAE is now India's third largest trading partner, after US & China.

112.title: I was prepared to bowl hard lengths: Siraj on posting 4/17 vs NZ in Napier
112.article_body: India pacer Mohammed Siraj, who was adjudged 'Player of the Match' against New Zealand in third T20I in Napier, said the McLean Park wicket wasn't easy to bat. "I was prepared to bowl hard lengths which gave me the rewards...I just executed my plans," he added. Siraj posted bowling figures of 4-0-17-4. Match ended in a tie via DLS method.

113.title: Congress will form govt with full majority: Former Himachal party chief
113.article_body: Ahead of counting of votes in the state, former Himachal Pradesh Congress chief Sukhwinder Singh Sukhu on Monday claimed the party would form its government with a full majority. Himachal Pradesh would reject BJP's Hindutva agenda and elect a Congress government, Sukhu said. He claimed that AICC General Secretary Priyanka Gandhi Vadra mobilised the cadres in the state.

114.title: Rat faeces found in midday meal in K'taka school; headmaster demoted
114.article_body: The faeces of rats were found in rice and sambhar served in the midday meal at Government Higher Primary School in Harapanahalli taluk of Karnataka's Vijayanagara district on Monday. Following the incident, the school's headmaster was reportedly demoted to an assistant teacher, and four cooks, who failed to recognise the rat droppings while cooking, were let off with a warning.

115.title: Warm congratulations: PM Modi as Tokayev wins Kazakhstan Prez polls
115.article_body: Prime Minister Narendra Modi on Monday congratulated Kassym-Jomart Tokayev for winning the Presidential polls in Kazakhstan. "My warm congratulations to President Tokayev," the PM tweeted, adding, "I look forward to continuing working together, to further strengthen our bilateral partnership." Tokayev won the snap elections with 81.31% of the votes and secured himself a second term of seven years.

116.title: Maha declares 1-day paid leave for voters in some border districts for Guj polls
116.article_body: Maharashtra government has declared one-day paid leave in bordering districts like Palghar, Nashik, Nandurbar and Dhule for voters enlisted in Gujarat Assembly elections. The elections will be held on December 1 and December 5. The government has also asked organisations to grant leave or a minimum of two-hour concession in working hours to the workers, employees and officers for elections.

117.title: IFS officer shares pic of homeless man sharing his mattress with stray dogs
117.article_body: Indian Forest Service (IFS) officer Susanta Nanda took to Twitter to share a photo that shows a homeless man sleeping with several dogs. He can be seen sleeping on the pavement on his tiny mattress. "Our heart has to be large enough to accommodate this big world," the photo caption reads.

118.title: Move Koshyari out, appoint new Guv: Cong amid Guv's remarks on Shivaji
118.article_body: Congress leader Ashok Chavan on Tuesday said Maharashtra Governor Bhagat Singh Koshyari should be removed from his office for his remark on Chhatrapati Shivaji Maharaj and demanded the appointment of a new governor. "The statement made by the Governor has intensified people's anger," Chavan said. Governor BS Koshyari called Chhatrapati Shivaji Maharaj an idol of "olden times".

119.title: Condemnable, says BJP after Raj CM calls Shraddha's murder an accident
119.article_body: BJP criticised Rajasthan CM Ashok Gehlot after he termed Shraddha Walkar's murder by her live-in partner as an "accident". Calling Gehlot's statement "condemnable", BJP leader Satish Poonia said, "It seems that the sentiment of Shraddha murder case has no effect on him. On the contrary, the CM is trying to justify that it was a normal incident."

120.title: Unaccounted income worth ₹100 cr detected after raids on Bihar-based businesses
120.article_body: The Income Tax Department discovered "unaccounted" income worth over ₹100 crore after conducting searches on various Bihar-based business groups dealing in real estate and diamond jewellery. Incriminating documents showing income evasion were also seized, the Department said. Unaccounted cash and jewellery worth over ₹5 crore were seized and 14 bank lockers were sealed during the operation.

121.title: 1-year-old girl gets 115 stitches on face after stray dog bites her in Ghaziabad
121.article_body: A one-year-old girl got 115 stitches during a 36-hour surgery after being attacked by a stray dog in UP's Ghaziabad. The child was attacked by the animal when she playing outside her home on Sunday, reports said. She had multiple injuries on her face, for which small stitches had to be administered, a doctor from MMG District Hospital said.

122.title: Imran Khan sold gold medal he received from India: Pakistan Defence Minister
122.article_body: Pakistan's former PM Imran Khan sold a gold medal he received from India during his cricketing years, Pakistan's Defence Minister Khawaja Asif claimed. Usually, such gifts are either permanently deposited in the Toshakhana or can be bought by the person who received them at a lower price. According to an earlier report, Khan admitted to selling at least four presents.

123.title: CAG initiates probe into BMC contracts worth ₹12,000 cr during pandemic
123.article_body: The Comptroller and Auditor General (CAG) has launched a probe into contracts worth ₹12,000 crore awarded by BMC during the COVID-19 pandemic. This comes after Maharashtra CM Eknath Shinde asked a probe to be conducted into projects undertaken between November 28, 2020 and February 28, 2022. The CAG team held a meeting with the municipal commissioner, a BMC official said.

124.title: Shilpa shares video with Raj Kundra on their 13th wedding anniversary
124.article_body: Actress Shilpa Shetty took to Instagram and shared a video with her husband Raj Kundra on their 13th wedding anniversary. Along with the video, Shilpa wrote, "13 years, Cookie, whoa! (and not counting). Thank you for sharing this journey with me in this lifetime and making it so beautiful...Happy Anniversary to us, Cookie." They have a son named Viaan.

125.title: Haryana's Mansa Devi temple area to be declared holy complex: CM Khattar
125.article_body: The Haryana government is planning to declare the Mata Mansa Devi temple area a 'holy complex'. "There will be a complete ban on the sale of liquor in an area of about 2.5 km around the temple," CM Manohar Lal Khattar said. He also gave updates about a Sanskrit college and old age home being built on the temple premises.

126.title: Turkey will attack militants with tanks and soldiers: Erdogan
126.article_body: Turkish President Recep Tayyip Erdogan said on Tuesday that Turkey would attack militants with tanks and soldiers "as soon as possible". This comes amid an escalation in retaliatory strikes between Turkish forces and Kurdish militants along the Syrian border. Turkish warplanes struck Kurdish militant bases in Syria and Iraq over the weekend following a blast in Istanbul earlier this month.

127.title: Indians most hurt by tech layoffs in US amid green card wait as long as 195 yrs
127.article_body: Mass layoffs at technology companies in the US have hurt Indians the most, Bloomberg reported. Indians tend to be on temporary visas longer than other foreign groups because of backlogs in getting permanent residency (a green card). A congressional report estimated that Indians filing in 2020 would have to wait as long as 195 years for a green card.

128.title: The best player of the last decade: Ex-Portugal footballer Figo on Messi
128.article_body: Praising Lionel Messi, ex-Portugal footballer Luis Figo said that the Argentina captain is one of the greatest players of all time and the best player of the last decade. The 35-year-old has won the Ballon d'Or a record seven times. Meanwhile, Argentina lost their opening match of FIFA World Cup 2022 against Saudi Arabia 1-2.

129.title: Even Kasab got a fair trial, I'm surely not worse: Satyendar Jain
129.article_body: Jailed Delhi minister Satyendar Jain on Tuesday, while accusing the Enforcement Directorate (ED) of leaking footage from inside his jail cell, said, "Even [terrorist] Ajmal Kasab got a free and fair trial...I'm surely not worse." "I am defamed every single minute by their act," he added. "I have lost 28 kg in jail...What privilege are they talking about?" Jain asked.

130.title: Ajay Devgn has not approached Salman Khan for 'Bholaa' sequel: Makers
130.article_body: 'Bholaa' makers have refuted the reports stating that actor Ajay Devgn has approached actor Salman Khan for the film's sequel. "Salman and Ajay share a great rapport & friendship, however, Ajay has not approached him for the sequel of 'Bholaa'," a statement by the makers read. 'Bholaa', which will be directed by Ajay, will release on March 30, 2023.

131.title: Weather is something we cannot control: Hardik on 3rd T20I ending in a tie
131.article_body: After India-New Zealand third T20I ended in a tie via DLS method following rain interruption in Napier on Tuesday, India skipper Hardik Pandya said his side would have liked to win the match by playing the full overs. "Weather is something we cannot control," he added. The DLS par score was 75 after nine overs and India were 75/4.

132.title: It was my dream to get selected in Ind women's hockey team: Beauty
132.article_body: After being selected for the Indian women's hockey squad, 19-year-old Beauty Dungdung said that it was her dream to feature in the senior side. "Growing up, I received a lot of support from my family to pursue the sport, especially my father," she said. Beauty was part of India's squad at the junior World Cup in South Africa in 2021.

133.title: 4.5 kg of ganja seized from 2 drug peddlers arrested in Bengaluru
133.article_body: Two people were arrested from Bengaluru's Kamakshipalya for allegedly peddling marijuana and about 4.53 kg of the drug was seized from them. "A case has been registered against the accused under the NDPS Act and...the investigation is going on," said police. Earlier, Bengaluru customs officials had arrested a person at Kempegowda International Airport for allegedly travelling with narcotics.

134.title: Inform us on enforcement of pet shop rules: HC to Delhi govt
134.article_body: The Delhi High Court (HC) has asked the government of the nation capital territory (NCT) to inform it of the "mode and manner" of implementing the Prevention of Cruelty to Animals (Pet Shop) Rules, 2018. A bench of justices Amit Sharma and Siddharth Mridul made the enquiry while hearing a PIL seeking regulation of pet shops in compliance of rules.

135.title: Journalist killed, another injured while crossing road in Hyderabad
135.article_body: A 27-year-old journalist was killed and her 26-year-old colleague injured as a speeding car hit the duo while they were crossing the street in Hyderabad's Hayathnagar. "This incident is not a hit-and-run. The car has been seized, and the driver will be taken into custody," said the police. The incident took place around 5:20 in the morning on NH-65.

136.title: 354 people died in road accidents in Noida from Jan-Oct 2022: Police
136.article_body: As many as 354 people died and 680 were injured in road accidents in Gautam Buddh Nagar till October this year, according to police data. In this period, 897 road accidents were recorded in the district, which houses Noida and Greater Noida. The data was shared to observe 'World Remembrance Day', which pays tributes to victims of road mishaps.

137.title: 4 dead, another critical after consuming illicit liquor in Haryana
137.article_body: Four residents of Haryana's Sonipat district died after consuming illicit liquor, police said on Tuesday. Another person, who also consumed the liquor on Monday night, is undergoing treatment at Bhagat Phool Singh Government Medical College for Women and his condition is said to be critical. "We are in the process of registering a case," a police spokesperson said.

138.title: Akshaye was unsure about doing Drishyam 2, said 'It's Ajay's film': Director
138.article_body: Abhishek Pathak, director of Ajay Devgn-starrer 'Drishyam 2', revealed that when he offered a role to Akshaye Khanna, he was "unsure" about doing it. "He asked, 'Why me? It's Ajay sir's film...If you bring me in...something different has to be there otherwise I don't know'," Abhishek added. He further said Akshaye agreed to do the film after reading the screenplay.

139.title: Meta rolls out privacy settings to protect teens from suspicious interactions
139.article_body: Facebook and Instagram parent Meta said that teens, under the age of 16, will now be defaulted into more private settings. Meta is testing ways to protect teens from messaging suspicious adults they aren't connected with. Meta is also working to build a global platform for teens who are worried their intimate images might be shared online without their consent.

140.title: UK launches probe over Apple & Google's 'stranglehold' on mobile browsers
140.article_body: UK's Competition and Markets Authority (CMA) has launched an in-depth investigation into the market dominance of Apple and Google's mobile browsers. This comes after a study concluded the companies have the power to "exercise a stranglehold". "Many UK businesses and web developers tell us they feel...they're being held back by restrictions set by Apple and Google," a CMA official said.

141.title: Hyderabad traffic drives not for increasing govt revenue: Police
141.article_body: Joint Commissioner of Police (Traffic) AV Ranganath said the special traffic drives in Hyderabad are aimed at bringing about a "behavioural change in vehicle users". He further denied claims that strict implementation of rules is being conducted to shore up government revenue. The Commissioner said officials will focus on educating vehicle users from November 28 till the following weekend.

142.title: Cage set up in south Bengaluru to trap leopard that killed calf
142.article_body: The Karnataka Forest Department has put up a cage near the Turahalli forest area in south Bengaluru to catch the leopard that killed a calf on November 19. "The leopard is constantly on the move. We are also tracking its movements," said a range forest officer. The forest officials also advised nearby residents to restrict travelling during the night.

143.title: I goofed up 'Dil...' audition, director gave me 2nd chance: Rupali
143.article_body: Actress Rupali Ganguly shared a clip from her old TV show 'Dil Hai Ke Manta Nahin' on Instagram and revealed she "goofed up" the TV serial's audition after hearing about the role. "I...pleaded with...director...Rajan Shahi to...give me a second chance...after much pleading he gave in...[I] auditioned for about nine scenes till he was convinced to cast me," she added.

144.title: ISRO scientist loses ₹18 lakh to conman in B'luru college seat scam
144.article_body: A conman cheated a 48-year-old ISRO scientist after promising him a medical seat for his daughter at Bengaluru's BGS Global Institute of Medical Science. The accused, Arun Das, took ₹18 lakh from Chidananda Shivappa Mugdum in the name of donation. While taking the money, Das promised to approach Mugdum later for admission. However, he never returned.

145.title: Farmers' bodies ask govt to lift export ban on wheat at pre-Budget meeting
145.article_body: Farmers' organisations have asked the government to lift the ban on export of agricultural items like wheat during the pre-budget meeting with the finance ministry. They also demanded to restrict the import of products costing below the minimum support price. Bodies have asked the government to increase the domestic output of local oilseeds like soyabean and sunflower instead of palm.

146.title: Boy with rare 'werewolf syndrome' in MP has hair growing all over body, pic surfaces
146.article_body: A teenager from Madhya Pradesh lives with a rare condition called 'werewolf syndrome'. Lalit Patidar, 17, a student from Nandleta village, was diagnosed with hypertrichosis at the age of six. Hypertrichosis is characterised by an abnormal amount of hair growth all over the body. There is no cure for Lalit's condition.

147.title: What is the new format of T20 World Cup?
147.article_body: The 2024 T20 World Cup will be played in new format wherein 20 participating countries will be divided into four groups of five teams each and the first round will be followed by a Super Eight stage. The top two sides in each of the two Super Eight groups will make the semi-finals, which will be followed by the final.

148.title: Barking dog seized with fear: North Korean leader Kim Jong-un's sister on US
148.article_body: North Korean leader Kim Jong-un's sister, Kim Yo-jong, likened the US to "a barking dog seized with fear". She said that the US was pushing the Korean peninsula towards a new crisis and warned of "the toughest counteraction". She also accused the UNSC of "double standards" after it convened a meeting over Pyongyang's launch of an intercontinental ballistic missile.

149.title: PhD student sets himself ablaze, hugs woman for rejecting his proposal in Maha
149.article_body: A 30-year-old PhD student died after setting himself ablaze at Government Institute of Science (GIS) in Maharashtra's Aurangabad on Monday afternoon, police said. The deceased, Gajanan Munde, followed a woman and hugged her after setting himself on fire to kill her for rejecting his marriage proposal. The woman sustained 55% burn injuries. Neither of the two people studied at GIS.

150.title: 186 kg of ganja worth ₹9 lakh seized in Tripura, 1 person arrested
150.article_body: Tripura Police, in a joint operation with Assam Rifles, busted a syndicate in which 186 kg of ganja worth approximately ₹9 lakh was seized, officials said on Tuesday. The police said they had registered a case under the Narcotic Drugs and Psychotropic Substances (NDPS) Act at the Sidhai police station. One person has been arrested in this connection.

151.title: One shouldn't get into acting just for money & fame: Pankaj Tripathi
151.article_body: Actor Pankaj Tripathi, sharing a piece of advice for young aspiring actors, said that one should not get into acting just for money and fame. "First understand why you want to come here (in the film industry)...understand your love, your needs," he added. "If you work with heart, money will eventually come to you at one point," Pankaj further said.

152.title: Revenue official arrested in Palghar for accepting bribe
152.article_body: A revenue official in Maharashtra's Palghar district was arrested for allegedly demanding and accepting a bribe. The government employee sought ₹30,000 from a man for updating the records of the plot purchased by the latter, an official said. The accused was posted in the district's Wada area and was caught red-handed by the Maharashtra Anti-Corruption Bureau officials.

153.title: China resumes streaming S Korean content after 6-year suspension
153.article_body: A Chinese streaming platform has resumed distributing South Korean content after suspending it for nearly six years, a South Korean official said on Tuesday. Notably, earlier this month, Chinese streaming site Tencent began distributing a South Korean film. China blocked Korean content amid tensions over the installation of the US-made THAAD missile defence system in South Korea in 2017.

154.title: Cong will fight to get crop insurance compensation to farmers: Patole
154.article_body: Maharashtra Congress President Nana Patole on Tuesday said the party will launch a drive to get compensation to farmers from the insurance companies. "The farmers...are going through a big crisis...Farmers are being looted openly by insurance companies with the blessings of the Modi government," Patole said. Crop insurance help desks will be established in all districts and talukas, he added.

155.title: Can't compromise on ideological issues like Savarkar, Hindutva: Raut
155.article_body: Shiv Sena MP Sanjay Raut on Tuesday said that Uddhav Thackeray-led Sena can't compromise on key issues like respect for VD Savarkar and Hindutva. Responding to Rahul Gandhi's comment on Savarkar, which had caused a row, Raut said, "If democracy, freedom and the Constitution are to be safeguarded, then we have to forget our differences and come together."

156.title: Court seeks Tihar jail's response on Satyendar Jain's plea for food
156.article_body: Delhi's Rouse Avenue court on Tuesday sought a response from Tihar jail authorities on Delhi Minister Satyendar Jain's plea for food, as per his religious beliefs. In his plea, Jain alleged that the jail authorities had stopped providing him with food items like fruits, vegetables, dry fruits and dates, which are necessary as he has been on a religious fast.

157.title: 410 kg marijuana seized from truck in Assam's Karimganj, driver escapes
157.article_body: The Assam police on Monday recovered around 410 kg of marijuana worth ₹41 lakh from a truck in Churaibari area along the Assam-Tripura border, police said. The truck's driver and cleaner allegedly managed to escape before the police intercepted the vehicle. Police are trying to find out the owner of the truck after verifying its registration number from transport authorities.

158.title: India will take up issue with Qatar: Puri on preacher Zakir Naik's World Cup lectures
158.article_body: India will take up the issue of Islamic preacher Zakir Naik being invited for lectures during the 2022 FIFA World Cup, with Qatar, Union Minister Hardeep Singh Puri said. Puri further said that the Mumbai-born fugitive evangelist is a Malaysian national. Naik founded the Islamic Research Foundation (IRF) which has been banned in India since 2016.

159.title: AAP plans magic shows, 1,000 'nukkad sabhas' for MCD polls
159.article_body: AAP has planned magic shows, street plays and 1,000 street-corner meetings with star campaigners for the second phase of MCD polls scheduled to take place on December 4. The theme of the second phase of the campaign is 'Kejriwal ki Sarkar, Kejriwal ka Paarshad'. AAP leader Gopal Rai said that Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal brought unprecedented development to the city.

160.title: B'luru sees highest growth in office rentals across Asia-Pacific: Report
160.article_body: As per Knight Frank's Asia-Pacific Prime Office Rental Index, Bengaluru posted the highest office rental growth in the Asia-Pacific region in the July-September quarter. Office rent in Bengaluru rose 12.1% year-on-year in the quarter. Jakarta was ranked second, followed by Mumbai. As per the data, rental growth in Bengaluru, Mumbai and Delhi-NCR remained flat compared with the April-June quarter.

161.title: Vedanta approves third interim dividend of ₹17.50 per share
161.article_body: Vedanta on Tuesday announced its third interim dividend of the current fiscal year of ₹17.50 per equity share. The dividend will lead to a total payout of ₹6,505 crore to shareholders. The company's board approved the interim dividend, which translates to 1750% of the face value of every share worth ₹1, according to an exchange filing.

162.title: Pune Police officials suspended, transferred for negligence in murder case
162.article_body: The Pune Police has suspended a sub-inspector and transferred two policemen pending an inquiry into alleged negligence in responding to harassment complaints by a woman who was recently murdered by her harasser. The accused officials have been identified as Vaishali Sool, Shamal Powar and Rajkumar Waghchaware, police said. The deceased was allegedly killed by the suspect, Pratik, on Wednesday.

163.title: Kejriwal, Sisodia misleading people: Alka Lamba on Jain's Tihar video
163.article_body: Congress leader Alka Lamba accused Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal and his deputy Manish Sisodia of misleading people after a video went viral of AAP leader Satyendar Jain getting massage in Tihar jail. "[Both said] that he is seriously unwell and was receiving physiotherapy…But later...Jail officials...revealed that he was not [a] physiotherapist but an inmate arrested for raping children," said Lamba.

164.title: 'It's the reflex': Veteran who helped disarm gunman at US gay club
164.article_body: An Army veteran who is one of two men being lauded for subduing the gunman during Saturday's mass shooting at an LGBTQ club in Colorado has attributed the apparently heroic act to his military instincts. "It's the reflex: Go! Go to the fire...Stop the activity. Don't let no one (sic) get hurt," US Army veteran Rich Fierro said on Monday.

165.title: UK-India FTA a high priority, negotiations to begin next month: Piyush Goyal
165.article_body: Commerce and Industry Minister Piyush Goyal said the negotiations for the free trade agreement (FTA) between India and UK are slated to happen next month. "With UK, we are doing a comprehensive deal like the UAE...I assure you that it's a high priority of both countries," Goyal added. The trade between the two countries increased to $17.5 billion in 2021-22.

166.title: What is a leap second and why is it being scrapped?
166.article_body: A leap second is a one-second adjustment occasionally applied to Coordinated Universal Time (UTC) either on June 30 or on December 31 to adjust the difference between exact atomic time and Earth's slower rotation. Technology companies, which have to synchronise their systems worldwide to add leap second, protest the practice. Now, governments have decided to scrap leap seconds by 2035.

167.title: I watch 2-3 scenes of Sholay when I face creative block: RRR writer
167.article_body: 'RRR' writer Vijayendra Prasad called himself a fan of Salim Khan and Javed Akhtar. He said that he watches two-three scenes from their film 'Sholay' whenever he faces "a creative block". The writer also spoke about how 1957 film 'Mayabazar' influenced his filmography. "In that film...Not even a single shot is wasted," he added.

168.title: North Goa beaches to have no-take zones to protect environment: Govt
168.article_body: Goa Minister Vishwajit Rane on Tuesday announced 'no-take zones' will be set up at Morjim, Ashvem and Arambol beaches to protect and preserve the environment. "Activities are taking place without permission and destruction of sand dunes is taking place," he tweeted. A no-take zone is an area where extractive activities like fishing, hunting, logging, mining and drilling aren't allowed.

169.title: Messi-led Argentina lose 1-2 against 51st-ranked Saudi Arabia in 2022 FIFA WC
169.article_body: Lionel Messi-led Argentina lost 1-2 against 51st-ranked Saudi Arabia in their 2022 FIFA World Cup opener on Tuesday. Messi opened the scoring for Argentina in the 10th minute through a penalty. Forward Saleh Al-Shehri equalised for Saudi Arabia in the 48th minute, with mid-fielder Salem Al Dawsari scoring the winner five minutes later.

170.title: WHO to identify pathogens that could cause future pandemics, 'Disease X' on list
170.article_body: WHO is launching a global scientific process to update the list of priority pathogens. WHO is convening over 300 scientists who will consider evidence on over 25 virus families and bacteria, as well as 'Disease X'. 'Disease X' is included to indicate an unknown pathogen that could cause serious international epidemic. The current list includes COVID-19 and SARS, among others.

171.title: Samajwadi Party leader Azam Khan gets bail in 2019 hate speech case
171.article_body: A sessions court in UP's Rampur on Tuesday granted bail to Samajwadi Party leader Azam Khan in a 2019 hate speech case, which had led to his disqualification from the UP Assembly. Khan, along with two others, was sentenced to three years in jail, following his comments on UP CM Yogi Adityanath.

172.title: TN reporting over 4,500 conjunctivitis cases daily, state govt issues warning
172.article_body: Cases of conjunctivitis, also known as 'Madras Eye', have been rising in Tamil Nadu, with the state reporting over 4,500 cases daily. State Health Minister Ma Subramanian has urged people to avoid self-medication and not use medicines prescribed to other family members. "The medication...is subjective from person to person. If...wrong medicine is used, it...may cause loss of vision," he said.

173.title: Actor Ranjeet's son Jeeva to make his B'wood debut with 'Govinda...'
173.article_body: Veteran actor Ranjeet's son Jeeva is making his Bollywood debut with Vicky Kaushal's upcoming film 'Govinda Naam Mera'. Sharing his look from the film, Ranjeet wished luck to his son and the film's team.
