Talking about his debut, Jeeva said, "It feels surreal...This journey gave me the rare opportunity to absorb invaluable experience from the best of our industry."

174.title: 'Kantara' becomes second Kannada film to cross ₹400 cr worldwide
174.article_body: Rishab Shetty's 'Kantara' has become the second Kannada film to cross ₹400 crore mark worldwide. The film has collected ₹400.90 crore worldwide. Over the weekend, it also became the highest-grossing film in Karnataka by overtaking the mark set by Yash-starrer 'KGF: Chapter 2'. In North India, 'Kantara' is inching closer to ₹100 crore mark.

175.title: Western Railways' longest skywalk to connect Bandra Suburban Station & Terminus
175.article_body: The Western Railways is all set to construct a new 340-metre-long skywalk that will connect the Bandra Suburban Station and Bandra Terminus in Mumbai. This skywalk will surpass the 314-metre-long skywalk between the Khar Railway Station and Bandra Terminus to become the longest skywalk of the Western Railways. The estimated cost of the project is around ₹32.3 crore.

176.title: Centre may provide ₹1.6 lakh cr additional funds for rural schemes
176.article_body: The Centre is likely to increase its allocation to the Ministry of Rural Development by 18% to ₹1.6 lakh crore to bolster the Mahatma Gandhi National Rural Employment Guarantee Act (MNREGA), Reuters reported citing a government source. Of the budgeted ₹73,000 crore for MNREGA, the Centre has already spent ₹63,260 crore. The rural unemployment rate in October was reportedly 8.04%.

177.title: Jio gains 7.24 lakh users in Sept, Airtel adds 4.12 lakh users: TRAI
177.article_body: Reliance Jio added 7.24 lakh mobile subscribers in September, according to data released by the Telecom Regulatory Authority of India (TRAI). India's total mobile subscriber base fell by 36 lakh in September, with Vodafone Idea (VI) facing a decline of 40 lakh in September. Bharti Airtel added 4.12 lakh subscribers in September, the data showed.

178.title: Credit Suisse lays off a third of its China-based investment bankers: Report
178.article_body: Credit Suisse has laid off nearly one-third of its China-based investment banking team and almost half of its research department, Reuters reported citing sources. The report added that over 20 China-based investment bankers were notified about job cuts and 10 employees in the research department were fired. Last month, Credit Suisse announced a capital raise of 4 billion Swiss francs.

179.title: Kim's daughter, seen in public for 1st time, is his second child: Spy agency
179.article_body: North Korean leader Kim Jong Un's daughter, who was seen in public for the first time recently during a visit to a missile site, is his second child, a South Korean spy agency said. The girl is named Ju Ae and is aged around 10, it told South Korean lawmakers. Kim's wife Ri Sol Ju also observed the missile launch.

180.title: Zerodha fixes glitches after users complain of losses while trading
180.article_body: Zerodha users on Tuesday complained that they were facing issues during the morning trading and were unable to login to their accounts and check, or modify their orders. While Zerodha apologised for the inconvenience and said the glitches were resolved, some users said that orders were still not getting executed. "Trade execution was unaffected," said a company official.

181.title: Europe to be hit hardest by global slowdown: OECD
181.article_body: The global economy should avoid a recession next year but the worst-energy crisis since the 1970s will trigger a sharp slowdown and Europe will be hit the hardest, Organisation for Economic Co-operation and Development (OECD) said. The global economic growth is set to slow from 3.1% this year to 2.2% next year before accelerating to 2.7% in 2024, it said.

182.title: Kartik seeks blessings at Siddhivinayak Temple on his b'day, pics surface
182.article_body: Actor Kartik Aaryan, who turned 32 on Tuesday, visited Siddhivinayak Temple in Mumbai to seek blessings on his birthday, along with his parents. In videos and pictures that have surfaced, he can be seen posing for the photographers outside the temple and clicking pictures with some fans. On the work front, Kartik will next be seen in 'Freddy' and 'Shehzada'.

183.title: BJP uses 'giant mosquito' to protest against rising dengue cases in WB
183.article_body: West Bengal BJP leaders took to the streets of Kolkata to protest against the rising number of dengue cases in the state. In a video, the BJP leaders can be seen protesting against the government using a mosquito net and a giant model of a mosquito. "Health Minister doesn't come to the House (Assembly)," said BJP leader Suvendu Adhikari.

184.title: Telangana Congress leader M Shashidhar Reddy quits the party
184.article_body: Senior Telangana Congress leader and former minister M Shashidhar Reddy on Tuesday announced his resignation from the party. His resignation comes days after the Congress expelled him for six years following his meeting with Union Home Minister Amit Shah. Addressing a press conference, Reddy claimed the Congress has not been able to effectively take on TRS in the state.

185.title: Mental health festival 'UDAAN' to be held in Hyderabad on Nov 27
185.article_body: An NGO is set to hold a mental health festival named UDAAN at the Exhibition Grounds in Hyderabad's Nampally on November 27. The festival seeks to tackle mental health-related taboos and focus on how to overcome struggles with the help of art, media and dialogues. It'll comprise of nine events, including 'Circle of Relatability', 'Glee Praxis' and 'Taare Zameen Par'.

186.title: Akshay to join Taapsee, Vaani & Ammy in comedy film Khel Khel Mein: Reports
186.article_body: Akshay Kumar has signed on to star in a comedy film titled 'Khel Khel Mein', as per reports. The upcoming film will also feature Vaani Kapoor, Taapsee Pannu and Ammy Virk in prominent roles, reports added. It will reportedly be directed by filmmaker Mudassar Aziz, who has previously helmed films like 'Happy Bhaag Jayegi' and 'Pati Patni Aur Woh'.

187.title: Hyderabad Police issue traffic advisory for phase 2 of SNDP works
187.article_body: Hyderabad Police issued traffic restrictions ahead of the commencement of the Strategic Nala Development Programme (SNDP) phase two works for 3 months. The traffic restrictions will be in place for the construction of the nullah between Rasoolpura to Ramgopalpet police station on Minister Road in Begumpet. Patients going to KIMS Hospital, Minister Road will have to take U-turn at CTO.

188.title: Air India most-punctual airline in Oct with 90.8% punctuality: DGCA
188.article_body: Air India was the most-punctual airline in October with a 90.8% punctuality, the Directorate General of Civil Aviation (DGCA) data showed. The On-Time Performance (OTP) of scheduled domestic airlines is recorded at four metro airports—Bengaluru, Delhi, Hyderabad and Mumbai. The second and third-best punctual airlines were Vistara and AirAsia. These were followed by IndiGo.

189.title: Video shows Japanese World Cup fans cleaning Qatar stadium after match, praised
189.article_body: A video has shown Japanese World Cup tourists cleaning a stadium in Qatar after the opening match between Ecuador and the host country on Sunday. The video was posted on Instagram by Bahraini content creator Omar Farooq, after which it went viral. The Japanese spectators were praised by online users for their cleaning efforts which included collecting littered flags.

190.title: Drug trafficking from across border major concern for Northeast: CM Saha
190.article_body: Tripura CM Manik Saha on Tuesday said drug trafficking from across the border is a major concern for the northeast region. He inaugurated the two-day meeting of DGPs and heads of Central Police Organisations (CPOs) of the northeast region. "The two-day meeting…will throw light on the problem and find ways for tackling it effectively," CM Saha stated.

191.title: BJP says actors paid to walk with Rahul Gandhi, Congress rejects claim
191.article_body: The BJP has alleged that the Congress party is paying actors to walk with MP Rahul Gandhi in the Bharat Jodo Yatra and shared an anonymous WhatsApp message to support its claim. Meanwhile, the Congress replied to the unnamed message and said that this shows how desperately the BJP is trying to discredit the yatra.

192.title: It's like national team facing village team: Aakash on TN scoring 506
192.article_body: Talking about Tamil Nadu becoming the first-ever team to breach the 500-run mark in a List A (50-over) match after scoring 506 in a Vijay Hazare Trophy clash against Arunachal Pradesh, commentator Aakash Chopra tweeted, "How's this correct?" "It's like a national team playing against a village team...What purpose does it serve to have this sort [of]...contest?" added Aakash.

193.title: Meta sued in UK over collecting, processing personal data for ads
193.article_body: Human rights campaigner, Tanya O'Carroll, has sued Meta in the UK for "surveillance advertising", the law firm representing her said. O'Carroll alleged that Meta breached UK data laws by not respecting her right to demand Facebook to stop processing her data for advertisements. "This case is...about us all being able to connect with social media on our...terms," said O'Carroll.

194.title: Death toll from Indonesia's earthquake rises to 268; 151 still missing
194.article_body: The death toll from a 5.6-magnitude earthquake that hit Indonesia's West Java province on Monday has risen to 268 as more bodies were found beneath collapsed buildings, the national disaster mitigation agency said. Around 151 people are still missing, it added. Authorities reported that over 300 people were seriously wounded and at least 600 more have suffered minor injuries.

195.title: Delhi excise dept raids birthday party, seizes 65 alcohol bottles
195.article_body: Delhi's excise department arrested a man from Delhi following a raid at a birthday party, where alcohol was being served without a liquor license, officials said on Monday. The Excise Intelligence Bureau (EIB) has also seized over 65 bottles of high-end liquor. The seized liquor bottles included 19 bottles of Chivas Regal and four bottles of Grey Goose Vodka.

196.title: German priest abducted by suspected Islamists in Mali's capital
196.article_body: A German priest was abducted by suspected Islamic extremists in Mali's capital, Bamako, on Sunday. Reverend Hans-Joachim Lohre was preparing to go celebrate Mass in another part of the city when he was kidnapped, Dia Monique Pare, Lohre's colleague, said. The alleged abduction is said to be the first kidnapping of a Westerner in Bamako in more than a decade.

197.title: King Charles to host his 1st state visit for South African President
197.article_body: King Charles will host his first state visit, since his accession to the throne, for South African President Cyril Ramaphosa on Tuesday. The late Queen Elizabeth II hosted the last state visit in 2019 for former US President Donald Trump and his wife Melania Trump. Ramaphosa will be officially greeted by Prince and Princess of Wales, William and wife Kate.

198.title: It will be special that Maradona will not be present for WC: Messi
198.article_body: Argentina captain Lionel Messi said late Argentine football legend Diego Maradona not being present for the 2022 FIFA World Cup will make it "special". "It [feels] strange...to [not] see him in the stands," added Messi. This will be the first edition of the FIFA World Cup where Maradona will not be present in the stands to support Argentina.

199.title: Rozgar Mela recruits are my co-travellers in country's development: PM Modi
199.article_body: PM Narendra Modi hailed new recruits hired during the Rozgar Mela as his "colleagues and co-travellers" in the country's development. PM Modi on Tuesday distributed 71,056 appointment letters to new recruits at the Rozgar Mela. Launching an online orientation course for them, Karmayogi Prarambh module, PM Modi urged them to give him feedback after a month, like "colleagues and co-travellers".

200.title: US VP Harris visits Philippine island as part of her 3-day trip
200.article_body: US Vice President Kamala Harris visited the Philippine island of Palawan in the South China Sea during her three-day trip. On Monday, Harris pledged that the US would defend the Philippines if it came under attack. Beijing claims almost all of South China Sea as its own territory. Harris is the highest-ranking official from the Biden administration to visit Philippines.

201.title: Nykaa CFO Arvind Agarwal resigns
201.article_body: Nykaa's Chief Financial Officer (CFO) Arvind Agarwal is resigning from his position effective November 25. Agarwal is leaving to pursue other opportunities in the digital economy and startup space, the company said. Meanwhile, Nykaa Founder and CEO Falguni Nayar praised the executive for his "critical role" and said, "While we do regret losing him, we...wish him all the luck."

202.title: CBI files 500-page chargesheet in Goa court in Sonali Phogat murder case
202.article_body: The Central Bureau of Investigation has filed a chargesheet of around 500 pages against Sudhir Sangwan and Sukhwinder Singh, in connection with the murder of Sonali Phogat, before a court in Goa. Reports said that CBI accused Phogat's personal assistant of murder and of forcing her to take drugs. Phogat was declared dead in North Goa on August 23.

203.title: China set to impose fine of over $1 bn on Jack Ma's Ant Group: Reports
203.article_body: Chinese authorities may reportedly impose a fine of over $1 billion on Jack Ma's Ant Group. The People's Bank of China is readying the fine. Ant Group's $37-billion IPO was suspended at the last minute in 2020. The fine on Ant would be the largest regulatory penalty imposed on a Chinese internet company since the $1.2-billion fine on Didi Global.

204.title: UP court gives life imprisonment to man who killed woman for property
204.article_body: A court in Uttar Pradesh sentenced a man to life imprisonment for killing a woman for property. The man first conspired with the woman, his friend's wife, to kill him, as per the prosecution. When the woman refused to hand over her dead husband's property to him, he murdered her too by stabbing her in the neck.

205.title: Situation in Iran critical: UN rights chief amid anti-hijab protests
205.article_body: The UN High Commissioner for Human Rights Volker Turk said the situation in Iran was "critical" as over 300 people have died in the past two months amid anti-hijab protests. Iran has been gripped by nationwide protests since the death of 22-year-old woman Mahsa Amini in morality police custody on September 16 after being arrested for wearing clothes deemed "inappropriate".

206.title: 3,165 tickets were issued on day bridge collapsed in Morbi: Probe report
206.article_body: A forensic probe report into the bridge collapse in Morbi has claimed 3,165 tickets were issued on October 30, the day of the incident. "According to the FSL report, the cables of the bridge were rusty, anchors were broken and bolts that connect cables with anchors were loose," a government lawyer said. He claimed Oreva Group didn't take any precautions.

207.title: Lionel Messi becomes 1st Argentinian to score at 4 different FIFA World Cups
207.article_body: Argentina captain Lionel Messi on Tuesday became the first-ever Argentinian footballer to score at four different World Cups. Messi achieved the feat after opening the scoring for Argentina in their 2022 FIFA World Cup opener against Saudi Arabia today. Prior to 2022 FIFA World Cup, Messi had scored in the 2006, 2014 and 2018 editions.

208.title: NHAI begins anti-encroachment drive near Pune's Navale bridge
208.article_body: The National Highways Authority of India (NHAI) has launched an anti-encroachment drive on the sides of the highway and service roads near Pune's Navale bridge area. The step comes after an accident occurred on the Katraj-Dehu Road Bypass on Sunday in which around 48 vehicles got damaged and at least six people sustained injuries and had to be hospitalised.

209.title: Dr Reddy's faces antitrust lawsuit in US over cancer drug Revlimid
209.article_body: Hyderabad-based Dr Reddy's Laboratories, along with US-based Celgene and Bristol Myers Squibb, is facing an antitrust lawsuit in US over a cancer drug. The complaint, filed on November 18 in New Jersey, alleges the companies improperly restrained competition concerning generic Revlimid and maintained a shared monopoly. The complaint seeks damages for purported overpayments and equitable relief.

210.title: 6 die in Assam-Meghalaya border firing, internet shut in 7 Meghalaya districts
210.article_body: Six persons, including an Assam forest official, died in firing at the Assam-Meghalaya border after the Assam forest department intercepted a truck allegedly transporting illegal timber. Meghalaya has suspended internet services in seven districts, namely West Jaintia Hills, East Jaintia Hills, East Khasi Hills, Ri-Bhoi, Eastern West Khasi Hills, West Khasi Hills and South West Khasi Hills.

211.title: Bill Gates shares list of his 5 all-time favourite books
211.article_body: Bill Gates shared a list of his five all-time favourite books in his annual holiday reading recommendations. Gates said this year, he didn't just choose books he read in the previous year. The list includes his favourite sci-fi book since his childhood, 'Stranger in a Strange Land' by Robert Heinlein, and a brand new memoir by U2's Bono called 'Surrender'.

212.title: NPAs increased by 365%, ₹10 lakh crore written off in last 5 years: Shrinate
212.article_body: The Congress criticised the Centre over the 365% rise in non-performing assets (NPAs) and asked the government about its plan to bring back wilful defaulters. Congress leader Supriya Shrinate claimed that in the last five years, the government has written off ₹10 lakh crore and only 13 percent of that amount has been recovered.

213.title: MMRDA to prepare a Climate Action Plan to tackle climate change
213.article_body: A Climate Action Plan is being prepared by Mumbai Metropolitan Region Development Authority (MMRDA) to help authorities tackle potential challenges posed by the likelihood of floods and rising temperature. "Climate change possesses a significant risk threatening the present and future," an official said. The Climate Action Plan will be implemented along with United Nations Environment Programme.

214.title: Brazil, Argentina football fans clash in Kerala's Kollam
214.article_body: A clash broke out between fans of Brazilian and Argentinian football teams during a roadshow in Kerala's Kollam district. The roadshow was held during the FIFA World Cup inauguration in Qatar. A video surfaced showing the fans punching, kicking and wrestling with each other, while some used sticks to strike. The police have lodged an FIR.

215.title: Domestic air passenger traffic in Oct increases over 27% YoY to 1.14 cr
215.article_body: Domestic air passenger traffic increased 27% year-on-year to 1.14 crore passengers in October, data released by the Directorate General of Civil Aviation showed (DGCA). During the January-October 2022 period, domestic airlines carried 9.88 crore passengers, up 59% from 6.20 crore during the year-ago period. As per the data, domestic leader IndiGo's market share dipped to a five-month low of 56.7%.

216.title: Absence of Mane is problem for us: Senegal manager after loss to Netherlands
216.article_body: After Senegal's 0-2 loss against Netherlands in their first Group A match at FIFA World Cup 2022, Senegal manager Aliou Cisse said his side is disappointed to have not scored, adding they had two or three very good chances. "Ismaila Sarr and Krepin Diatta are responsible there, but of course...absence of Sadio Mane is a problem for us," he stated.

217.title: BBMP suspends 3 revenue officials over B'luru voter data theft case
217.article_body: Civic body BBMP on Monday suspended three revenue officials, who were also electoral officers of Assembly constituencies, for their alleged involvement in the Bengaluru voter data theft case. The accused allegedly issued block-level government ID cards to the NGO which collected personal data of voters by using the cards. Krishnappa Ravikumar, the Co-founder of the NGO, was earlier arrested.

218.title: Mumbai Traffic Police receives hoax call about Dawood planning to kill PM Modi
218.article_body: Mumbai Traffic Police on Monday received a call and message about gangster Dawood Ibrahim planning to kill Prime Minister Narendra Modi. The caller told the police that two henchmen of Dawood have come to India to kill Modi and that Kerala Police were also summoned to foil his efforts. Police traced the caller and found that he was mentally unstable.

219.title: Not going to be mother in this life, want to have orphanage: Neha Bhasin
219.article_body: Singer Neha Bhasin said she's not going to be a mother in this life. "I want to have an orphanage, where I nurture at least 10 to 12 children, give them education, love...the life they deserve," she added. Neha stated she never had a "maternal instinct" of having her own children, however, was clear about adopting a child since childhood.

220.title: Parts of Pune to face water cut on Thursday
220.article_body: All the Peth areas, Quarter Gate, Lohianagar, Sahakarnagar, Padmavati, Bibwewadi, Maharshinagar, Gangadham, Katraj and Shivajinagar among others in Pune will face water cut on Thursday for repairs at Parvati substation. The areas that get supply from the SNDT water tank, like Bhandarkar Road, Law College Road, Karve Road, Yerawada, Chandangar and some parts of Sinhgad, will also face water cuts.

221.title: Wonder what kind of player he wants to be: Harsha on Pant's 11(5) vs NZ
221.article_body: Commentator Harsha Bhogle took to Twitter to discuss Rishabh Pant's 11 off five deliveries in India's third T20I against New Zealand, stating he "wonders" about the kind of player Pant wants to be in T20s. "If he wants to slog at the top, he will sell his rare skills short," said Bhogle in his tweet. Pant's knock comprised two fours.

222.title: Pregnant women to get free ultrasound, breakfast at UP health centres
222.article_body: Pregnant women will get free ultrasound facility and breakfast when they go for checkups at community health centres (CHCs) in Uttar Pradesh, said Deputy CM Brajesh Pathak. The facilities will be provided under the Pradhan Mantri Surakshit Matritva Abhiyan (PMSMA). "Ultrasound facility will start under public-private-partnership mode at health centres lacking [the] facility," added Pathak.

223.title: Mumbai Police arrest 2 from Jharkhand for cheating people in electricity bill fraud
223.article_body: The Mumbai Police arrested two persons from Jharkhand for allegedly cheating residents of Mumbai on the pretext of paying electricity bills. "We had a team in Jharkhand and looking at the modus operandi, we believed that some cheats from that state only...[were involved]," an investigating official said. Six mobile handsets and 10 SIM cards were reportedly seized during the search.

224.title: Iran enriching uranium to 60% purity at underground nuclear site
224.article_body: Iran has started enriching uranium to 60% purity at the country's underground Fordow nuclear plant, state media reported on Tuesday. The move is in response to the UN nuclear watchdog's demand for more cooperation from Tehran, state media said. As per the 2015 nuclear deal between Iran and the world powers, Iran is prohibited from enriching uranium above 3.67% purity.

225.title: UCO Bank stock up by 14% to touch 52-week high of ₹21.35 apiece
225.article_body: UCO Bank's stock surged by over 14% to hit a new 52-week high of ₹21.35/piece on Tuesday amid reports of shares changing hands. Around 1.18 crore shares or 0.1% reportedly changed hands in nine transactions on the NSE. Meanwhile, the central government has named Rajendra Kumar Saboo as the Executive Director of the bank for a period of three years.

226.title: Former Apple Daily journalists plead guilty to foreign collusion
226.article_body: A group of senior journalists who worked at a pro-democracy tabloid in Hong Kong, Apple Daily, have pleaded guilty to foreign collusion. Six journalists have admitted to conspiring with Apple Daily's founder Jimmy Lai to call for sanctions and blockades against China and Hong Kong. The former staffers face life imprisonment, the highest punishment under China's 2020 National Security Law.

227.title: 40 foreign nationals arrested during anti-govt protests: Iran
227.article_body: Iran has arrested 40 foreign nationals for their alleged involvement in the ongoing anti-government protests in the country, Iran's judiciary spokesman Masoud Setayeshi said on Tuesday. In September, Tehran said nine Europeans had been arrested in connection with the protests. Iran maintains that "foreign adversaries" are behind the protests, which were sparked by Mahsa Amini's custodial death.

228.title: Virat Kohli, Anushka Sharma rent a flat in Mumbai's Juhu for ₹2.76 lakh per month
228.article_body: Ex-Team India captain Virat Kohli and his wife, actress Anushka Sharma, have rented a flat for ₹2.76 lakh per month in Mumbai's Juhu. The apartment is owned by cricket administrator and former cricketer Samarjitsinh Gaekwad, who is also a descendant of the royal family of Baroda. The flat is spread over 1,650 sq ft.

229.title: Google parent Alphabet plans to fire 10,000 'low-performing' employees: Report
229.article_body: Google's parent company Alphabet is planning to fire about 10,000 "low-performing" employees or 6% of its workforce, as per a report. Google managers have been asked to identify and rank 6% staff as 'poor performing', in contrast to 2% in the previous performance review system. The new system also reduces the percentage of employees that can score a high rating.

230.title: Australian Parliament approves Free Trade Agreement with India
230.article_body: Australian Prime Minister Anthony Albanese announced that the Australian Parliament has ratified the Free Trade Agreement (FTA) with India. The announcement comes days after Albanese said that he will visit India in March 2023. Commerce and Industry Minister Piyush Goyal had earlier said FTA would take bilateral trade from $27.5 billion to $45-50 billion in the next five years.

231.title: Can't control people's reactions: 'Laal...' maker on film facing criticism
231.article_body: 'Laal Singh Chaddha' director Advait Chandan, reacting to the criticism that his film faced, said that he can't control people's reactions. He added that he only worries about things that he can control. "People, who are spending so much money to watch our films, have all the right to criticise," Advait further said.

232.title: AWS launches India's second infrastructure region in Hyderabad
232.article_body: Amazon Web Services (AWS) announced that it has launched the AWS Asia Pacific (Hyderabad) region, its second AWS infrastructure region in India, joining its first region in Mumbai. The company has also announced a planned investment of $4.4 billion (approximately ₹36,300 crore) in the India market by 2030. The investment is estimated to create over 48,000 full-time jobs annually.

233.title: India win 10th international series in a row as 3rd T20I against NZ ends in a tie
233.article_body: The third India-New Zealand T20I ended in a tie (DLS method) in Napier. India dismissed New Zealand for 160 in 19.4 overs and scored 75/4 in nine overs before rain occurred. The match ended in a tie as DLS par score for India after nine overs was 75. India clinched the series 1-0, their tenth consecutive series victory across formats.

234.title: Mohanlal is great but Hindi audience relates Drishyam more with Ajay: Maker
234.article_body: Director Abhishek Pathak spoke about his film 'Drishyam 2', which is a remake of Mohanlal-starrer Malayalam film of the same name. "Mohanlal sir is a great actor...but...Hindi audiences relate Drishyam somewhere more with...Ajay Devgn," he said. Abhishek added that even though the Malayalam film was released first, many people didn't watch it as they wanted to see the Hindi version.

235.title: Filmmaker in me has grown: Sidharth Malhotra on 10 yrs in Bollywood
235.article_body: Actor Sidharth Malhotra, who completed 10 years in the film industry in October, said the filmmaker in him has grown and the actor in him has learned "so much". "I finally have a voice. I can voice my personality or my viewpoints now much better in the filmmaking language," he added. Sidharth made his debut with 'Student Of The Year'.

236.title: Indian think tank reiterated they'll never change by picking Shreyas: Ganesh
236.article_body: Discussing India's lineup for their third T20I against New Zealand, ex-India cricketer Dodda Ganesh tweeted, "By picking Shreyas Iyer ahead of Sanju Samson, the Indian think tank has reiterated that they'll not learn from their mistakes." "[They've also reiterated that they'll] never change their approach towards T20s," added Ganesh. Shreyas was dismissed for a golden duck in the third T20I.

237.title: Al-Shabab gunman kills 3 Kenyan peacekeepers in southern Somalia
237.article_body: A lone gunman entered a military base in southern Somalia's Lower Jubba region and killed 3 Kenyan peacekeepers on Monday, according to Kenya's military. Five other soldiers were injured in the indiscriminate firing by the gunman, a Kenyan military official said under anonymity. The attacker was subsequently gunned down. Militant group al-Shabab has claimed responsibility for the attack.

238.title: Raveena Tandon shares video claiming 'stones thrown' at tiger in Bhopal park, probe begins
238.article_body: Authorities at Bhopal's Van Vihar National Park are probing an incident after Raveena Tandon shared a video claiming some miscreants threw stones at a tiger in enclosure. The authorities said action will be taken against them. The park's director said that the video did not show anyone throwing stones, but someone is heard shouting from behind, "Who threw the stone?"

239.title: BJP leader calls for FIFA WC boycott over invite to Indian fugitive
239.article_body: BJP leader Savio Rodrigues on Tuesday appealed to the government and those travelling to Qatar for the FIFA World Cup, to boycott the event over an invitation to Indian fugitive Zakir Naik. Rodrigues said that inviting Naik when the world was battling terrorism was akin to giving a terrorist a platform to spread hate.

240.title: Chief Secy directs officials to decongest 10 key areas in Bengaluru
240.article_body: Karnataka Chief Secretary Vandita Sharma directed the authorities to decongest bottlenecks from 10 major traffic junctions in Bengaluru during a coordination meeting held on Monday. Silk Board, Iblur, Jayadeva, MM Temple Junction at Tin Factory, Hebbal, Goraguntepalya, Sarakki, KS Layout, Kadubeesanahalli and Banashankari have been identified as the major bottlenecks by Bengaluru Traffic Police.

241.title: Broadcom's $61 billion deal to buy VMware faces probe in UK
241.article_body: Britain's Competition and Markets Authority is looking into opening a formal investigation into US chipmaker Broadcom's proposed $61 billion deal to buy cloud computing company VMware. The regulator aims to determine whether the deal would substantially lessen competition. The acquisition, announced in May, is the second largest globally so far this year and is being probed by US authorities too.

242.title: upGrad appoints Anuj Vishwakarma to lead online higher education
242.article_body: Higher edtech unicorn upGrad appointed Anuj Vishwakarma as the President of its online higher education programs. The company stated that Vishwakarma will be responsible for building the online higher-ed vertical and scaling the business in his new role. Before upGrad, the company said, he has driven growth for consumer internet players like Myntra, Paytm and Ola.

243.title: 2 policemen assaulted over loud music at DJ party in Gurugram
243.article_body: Three men allegedly assaulted two policemen who had gone to check a complaint of loud music at a DJ party in Gurugram, police said. Constable Bhupender alleged that the accused banged his head on the wall and also tore his uniform. He added that the accused also beat up Special Police Officer Ranbir when he intervened.

244.title: Putin to meet mothers of Russian soldiers amid Ukraine war: Report
244.article_body: Russian President Vladimir Putin will meet the mothers of Russian soldiers in the coming days amid the ongoing war in Ukraine, the Vedomosti newspaper reported, citing multiple sources. Russia celebrates Mother's Day on November 27. According to Ukraine's Defence Ministry, Ukrainian forces have killed more than 85,000 Russian soldiers since Moscow's invasion began on February 24.

245.title: Bruce Lee died at 32 from drinking too much water, claims study
245.article_body: Martial artist and actor Bruce Lee, who passed away at 32 in Hong Kong in July 1973, may have died from drinking too much water, a study suggested. An autopsy showed that he died from cerebral oedema, or brain swelling. Researchers suggest hyponatraemia caused oedema, while adding, "the kidney's inability to excrete excess water killed Bruce Lee."

246.title: 2 Indians take 4-wicket hauls in the same T20I for the first time in history
246.article_body: The third T20I between India and New Zealand on Tuesday marked the first instance of two Indian bowlers taking four-wicket hauls in the same T20I match. Fast bowler Arshdeep Singh registered bowling figures of 4-0-37-4 in the match, while Mohammed Siraj recorded figures of 4-0-17-4 as India bowled New Zealand out for 160 in 19.4 overs.

247.title: Smith waits to go off after getting caught behind as umpire waits for appeal, video viral
247.article_body: Australia batter Steve Smith waited to go off after getting caught behind as the umpire delayed his decision in their third ODI match against England on Tuesday. The video of the incident, which has gone viral, shows Smith gloving the ball and waiting, after which Jos Buttler appealed. Umpire Paul Wilson then raised his finger to send Smith back.

248.title: Technology is taking away a lot of jobs: Zerodha CEO Nithin Kamath
248.article_body: Zerodha CEO Nithin Kamath has said that "technology is taking away a lot of jobs". In an interview with BQ Prime, the billionaire stated, "Technology is just making things more and more efficient and medical progress is increasing the lifespan." He further said that it "might become very hard" for today's 20-year-olds to find a new job when they're 50.

249.title: You'll make India proud: Paytm CEO Vijay Shekhar to Ola's Bhavish
249.article_body: Paytm Founder and CEO Vijay Shekhar Sharma met Ola Co-founder Bhavish Aggarwal at the ride-hailing platform's headquarters and said that the team will make the country proud. Taking to Twitter, Sharma said, "Inspiring is an understatement for what I saw today at Ola." Replying to Sharma, Aggarwal said, "Wonderful to see you Vijay, and thanks for the inspiration!"

250.title: 10-year-old girl dragged to forest, killed by leopard in UP
250.article_body: A 10-year-old girl was dragged to a forest and killed by a leopard while she was plucking vegetables from a field in Uttar Pradesh's Bahraich on Monday. After the locals raised an alarm and surrounded the animal, it left the girl and went into the forest. The victim succumbed to her injuries.

251.title: Hyderabad to get India's biggest projection screen at Prasads Multiplex
251.article_body: Hyderabad's Prasads Multiplex is upgrading its theatre and setting up the biggest projection screen in India, Assistant Manager (IT & Technical) of Prasads Cinemas Mohan Kumar said. The screen measures about 64 feet high and 101.6 feet wide. "[This screen is] tallest that can be made in the whole world," Kumar added. This projection facility will open from December 16.

252.title: 'Rozgar Melas' in NDA-ruled states benefit of double engine govts: PM
252.article_body: As PM Narendra Modi distributed over 71,000 appointment letters to new recruits at the Rozgar Mela on Tuesday, he said similar campaigns have been held in NDA-ruled states and UTs in the past one month. "This is double benefit of double-engine governments. The campaign to hand over appointment letters to youth shall continue in a sustained manner," PM Modi added.

253.title: Man arrested for molesting, assaulting girl in her home in Mumbai
253.article_body: A 26-year-old man was arrested for allegedly molesting and assaulting a 13-year-old girl at the latter's residence in the Chunabhatti area of Mumbai. The incident happened when the minor's parents were not present at their house, police said. Notably, the accused and victim live in the same locality. The complaint was filed after victim narrated the incident to her parents.

254.title: Fraudster cites medical emergency, cheats Maharashtra man of ₹18.5 lakh
254.article_body: A 52-year-old Nagpur resident was cheated of ₹18.5 lakh by a man who claimed to know his close friend, police said. The fraudster called the victim and said he was a close friend of victim's friend and that his mother was admitted to a hospital in Nagpur. He then requested the victim to make payments online urgently for medical expenses.

255.title: HDFC, IOC, others to issue bonds tomorrow to raise ₹9,200 cr: Report
255.article_body: About six companies including HDFC, Indian Oil Corporation (IOC) and Rural Electrification Corporation (REC) are reportedly planning to raise ₹9,200 crore through corporate bonds on Wednesday. REC is aiming ₹4,000 crore, which includes ₹3,500 crore in greenshoe through bonds maturing in 180 months, while IOC is aiming ₹2,500 crore, including ₹1,500 crore in greenshoe through five-year bonds.

256.title: BluSmart plans to raise $250 mn to expand to 6 cities by 2024
256.article_body: Gurugram-based electric ride-hailing platform BluSmart plans to raise $250 million to expand its presence to six cities with a fleet of 25,000 cars by the end of 2024. The startup has raised $75 million so far from venture capitalists like BP Ventures, Mayfield and 9Unicorns. BluSmart claims its premium segment pricing is 15% cheaper than the competition on an average.

257.title: Anganwadi workers go on indefinite dharna, 60,000 centres shut in Odisha
257.article_body: About 60,000 Anganwadi centres have been shut as Anganwadi workers have gone on an indefinite dharna in Odisha. Reports said that the workers are demanding status of government employees and ₹18,000 for Anganwadi workers and ₹9,000 for their assistants. Their demands also include compensation of ₹5 lakh to family of an Anganwadi worker in case of death during service period.

258.title: Not yet: Rana Daggubati on wife Miheeka's pregnancy rumours
258.article_body: Actor Rana Daggubati has denied the rumours that he and his wife Miheeka Daggubati are expecting their first child. Reacting to the claims that his wife Miheeka is pregnant, Rana said, "Not yet...If I am having a baby, I'll be sure." Rana spoke about the rumours in conversation with singer Kanika Kapoor, who had congratulated him on the news.

259.title: It looked like a bad tackle but he carried on: Southgate on Kane's injury vs Iran
259.article_body: England manager Gareth Southgate has said Harry Kane is fine after the England captain went down following a tackle during their FIFA World Cup match against Iran. Kane eventually got up and played, but he was substituted in the 75th minute for Callum Wilson. "We took him off because we felt it was a moment...we could do that," said Southgate.

260.title: UP CM Yogi, Akhilesh pay tribute to Mulayam Singh on his birth anniversary
260.article_body: UP CM Yogi Adityanath and SP President Akhilesh Yadav paid tribute to ex-CM Mulayam Singh on his birth anniversary. Akhilesh tweeted a photo of him and referred to him as the 'son of soil'. The Samajwadi Party is also commemorating his birth anniversary as 'Dharti Putra Diwas'. Mulayam Singh was born in 1939 in Saifai, Etawah.

261.title: Malayalam & Hindi versions of Drishyam 3 to release on same day: Report
261.article_body: The Malayalam and the Hindi versions of 'Drishyam 3' will reportedly be released on the same day. This comes after Ajay Devgn's 'Drishyam 2', which is a remake of a Malayalam film, earned ₹64 crore on its first weekend. "The idea of the third part was originally there as well, the stupendous collection has only strengthened it," a source stated.

262.title: 23-yr-old son of Telangana minister's ex-aide dies by suicide in Hyd
262.article_body: The 23-year-old son of a former personal assistant of Telangana Excise and Prohibition Minister Srinivas Goud died by suicide on Monday in Hyderabad. Akshay Kumar, who was accused of taking money to allot houses under a government scheme, hanged himself at his sister's house. Two months ago, a case had been registered against Kumar in connection with the scam.

263.title: Law student records girls in university toilets in B'luru, booked
263.article_body: A 21-year-old law student has been booked for allegedly recording videos of girls in the toilets of a private university in Bengaluru, police said on Tuesday. Earlier, the man had been caught peeping into the girls' toilet and was let off after he submitted an apology letter. When he repeated the act two days later, the management called the police.

264.title: B'luru man sues Reliance Retail for charging ₹24.9 for carry bag, wins ₹7,000 compensation
264.article_body: A Bengaluru-based advocate won a case against Reliance Retail after he was forced to purchase a carry bag for ₹24.9 after shopping for items worth ₹2,007. The city consumer court ruled that Reliance Retail must refund ₹24.9 to the customer and also pay him a compensation of ₹5,000 along with ₹2,000 towards his court expenses.

265.title: Interned at Mukul Anand's production house, got ₹5,000: Varun Dhawan
265.article_body: Actor Varun Dhawan revealed that he interned at Mukul Anand's production house for which he was paid ₹5,000. He recalled that during his internship, he got a chance to meet Sania Mirza and revealed that her mother had scolded him for getting an apple for the tennis star. "I think her mother thought I was cracked," he shared.

266.title: Special cell was made for Shah: AAP leader on Jain's massage videos
266.article_body: After reports claimed that the man seen in videos giving massage to Delhi minister Satyendar Jain is not a physiotherapist but a rape accused, AAP leader Gopal Rai said a special cell was made in Gujarat for Amit Shah. "The main issue is that the people of Delhi have decided to make AAP win in the MCD polls," Rai added.

267.title: Mumbai Police files chargesheet against Raj Kundra in pornography case
267.article_body: Mumbai Police has filed over 1000-page chargesheet against Bollywood actress Shilpa Shetty's husband Raj Kundra and others concerning the pornography case. Kundra's advocate Prashant Patil said they would follow the legal procedure to collect the chargesheet and added that his client has nothing to do with the said crime. Last year, Kundra was arrested for allegedly producing pornographic films.

268.title: We were in tears as B'wood films were performing so badly: Manoj Desai
268.article_body: Discussing the success of 'Drishyam 2', Manoj Desai, who is the Executive Director of Maratha Mandir Cinema said, "We were in tears because Bollywood films were performing so badly." "After...many years, a film's delivered houseful shows," added Desai. "[This is the first instance in a long period of time where]...we're bathing in the waters of...river Ganga with producers," he stated.

269.title: 3 BJP leaders booked in Gujarat's Vadodara for making casteist remarks
269.article_body: Three BJP leaders, Biren Shah, Vishal and Amit Solanki, have been booked under the SC/ST (Prevention of Atrocities) Act in Gujarat's Vadodara for allegedly insulting and making casteist remarks against a tribal man. According to reports, Biren Shah threatened the victim to remove his vegetable cart once the state Assembly polls are over.

270.title: Twins born in US from embryos frozen 30 years ago, pic goes viral
270.article_body: A couple from US has welcomed twins born from embryos frozen on April 22, 1992. The National Embryo Donation Center believes the embryos are the longest-frozen to have resulted in a live birth. The embryos were initially created for an anonymous married couple and were kept at a fertility laboratory before being donated in 2007.

271.title: 21-yr-old law student records video of girls in Bengaluru university toilet; case filed
271.article_body: A case has been registered against a 21-year-old law student of a private university in Bengaluru for allegedly peeping into the girls' toilet and recording a video of them, police said on Tuesday. The accused was caught peeping inside the toilet in the past and was let off with a warning after he submitted an apology letter.

272.title: Congress to file complaint over video of girl with PM praising BJP
272.article_body: Congress will file a complaint against PM Narendra Modi after BJP tweeted a video of a girl praising the party while posing with the PM. Congress said that it will reach out to the National Commission for Protection Of Child Rights on Tuesday and file the complaint. TMC accused BJP of using a minor for its election campaign in Gujarat.

273.title: 1 killed, 29 hurt after bomb explodes in police compound in Thailand
273.article_body: At least one person has been killed and 29 others have been injured after a car bomb exploded inside a police compound in southern Thailand on Tuesday. "We're still clearing the area and the number of injured could increase," police said. Seven people were injured after explosions and fires ripped through at least 17 locations in southern Thailand in August.

274.title: Who has scored the most goals for Argentina in FIFA World Cup history?
274.article_body: Ex-Argentina forward Gabriel Batistuta holds the record for scoring the most goals for his country in FIFA World Cup history, with a total of 10 goals. He's followed by Guillermo Stabile and ex-captain Diego Maradona, both of whom scored eight goals each. Seven-time Ballon d'Or winner Lionel Messi has scored the joint third-highest six goals along with Mario Kempes.

275.title: Retired banker cheated of ₹33 lakh by investment firm in Pune
275.article_body: A case has been filed after a 71-year-old retired bank manager was allegedly cheated of ₹33 lakh by an investment firm run by a father-son duo in Pune. The bank manager had reportedly invested all his retirement money after the duo promised to double his investment. According to the complainant, the duo stopped taking his calls later.

276.title: Warner gives his gloves to young fan after slamming his 44th international hundred
276.article_body: Australia opener David Warner gave his gloves to a young fan in the stands after slamming his 44th international hundred in the third ODI against England in Melbourne on Tuesday. Warner did the gesture while walking towards the dressing room after getting out in the 39th over. Warner scored 106(102), his first international hundred after 1,042 days.

277.title: Reliance could create India's 5th largest financial services firm: Macquarie
277.article_body: Reliance Industries' plans to demerge its financial services business and list it could create India's fifth-largest financial services firm, Macquarie Capital Securities said. RIL plans to demerge its financial services undertaking into Reliance Strategic Investments and rename it Jio Financial Services (JFSL). HDFC Bank, SBI, ICICI Bank, and Axis Bank are the top four companies in the business.

278.title: Disney's outgoing CEO Bob Chapek to get $23 million as exit package: Report
278.article_body: Disney's outgoing CEO Bob Chapek is likely to receive exit payments and benefits worth more than $23 million, Bloomberg reported. Chapek is entitled to collect a salary for the full duration of his term, even if he's ousted prematurely, as per his contract. He's also entitled to pension accumulated over his decades-long career at Disney, which stands at $16.9 million.

279.title: English cricketer Laurie Evans fails dope test, loses BBL contract; denies wrongdoing
279.article_body: English batter Laurie Evans has returned a positive result from a sample sent for the anti-doping test during the second edition of The Hundred in August-September 2022. Evans, however, has denied taking any banned substance. "I was shocked...I don't know what caused the positive test," he stated. BBL's Perth Scorchers have terminated Evans' contract over the dope test result.

280.title: Thane resident killed after tree branch crashes down on car, case filed
280.article_body: A 38-year-old Thane resident died after a tree branch came crashing down on his car in Mumbai's Worli. "Metro works are going on in Worli...and the branch collapsed after a truck with sharp machinery for excavating rocks hit some branches of the tree adjoining the road," a civic official said. Police have lodged FIR against the truck driver.

281.title: SUV overturns as driver loses control due to pothole in UP; 5 dead
281.article_body: Five people were killed and at least six others injured after an SUV overturned into a ditch in Uttar Pradesh's Lakhimpur Kheri on Tuesday, police said. The driver of the SUV, which had 12 people on board, lost control due to a pothole on the road, an inspector said. Four of the deceased have been identified, police added.

282.title: Man catches one of the world's largest goldfish weighing over 30 kg in France, pic surfaces
282.article_body: A British fisherman named Andy Hackett has caught one of the world's largest goldfish weighing more than 30 kg in France. The fish, which is a cross between the leather carp and the koi carp, is nicknamed as the Carrot after its orange colour and was put into the Bluewater Lakes in Champagne, France 20 years ago.

283.title: 36 bridges found unfit for traffic in safety audit in Uttarakhand
283.article_body: As many as 36 bridges in Uttarakhand have been found to be unfit for traffic following a safety audit. The audit was carried out on the state CM's directions in the wake of Morbi bridge collapse tragedy. "Instructions have been given...to set up a bridge bank so that new bridges can be constructed," State Public Works Department Principal Secretary said.

284.title: Russian envoy urges Turkey to show restraint in Syria: Reports
284.article_body: Russia has urged Turkey to show restraint in its use of military force in Syria and keep tensions from escalating, Russian news agencies reported. Russian envoy Alexander Lavrentyev reportedly said that the country would work with interested parties in finding a peaceful solution to the "Kurdish issue". This comes after Turkish warplanes carried out strikes in Syria and Iraq.

285.title: Hacker, known for 1st unlocking iPhone, gets 12-week internship at Twitter in US
285.article_body: George Hotz, a 33-year-old American security hacker, has secured a 12-week internship at Twitter after he made a pitch to work for the "cost of living" in San Francisco, where Twitter headquarters are situated. He tweeted on Tuesday that he'll work on Twitter's search feature. Hotz is known for being the first person to unlock an Apple iPhone in 2007.

286.title: CM Kejriwal should apologise to nation: BJP leader on Jain's massage video
286.article_body: Reacting to jailed AAP leader Satyendar Jain's massage video which went viral, BJP's Gaurav Bhatia said Delhi CM and AAP national convenor Arvind Kejriwal should apologise to the nation. "Satyendar Jain shouldn't retain a Delhi minister post for a minute anymore," Bhatia added. "If Arvind Kejriwal is too weak to dismiss Satyendar Jain, then the CM should resign," Bhatia stated.

287.title: India stands with Indonesia: PM Modi after 162 die in earthquake
287.article_body: PM Narendra Modi has expressed grief after Indonesia was hit by an earthquake on Monday, that claimed 162 lives. "Saddened by the loss of lives and damage to property from the earthquake in Indonesia. Deepest condolences to the victims and their families," he tweeted, adding that India stands with Indonesia. PM Modi was recently in Indonesia for the G20 summit.

288.title: Farhan said 'Give me whatever comes to your mind': Rakeysh on 'Bhaag...'
288.article_body: Talking about the film 'Bhaag Milkha Bhaag' which was based on sprinter Milkha Singh, the movie's director Rakeysh Omprakash Mehra said, "Farhan Akhtar said, '[Give me] whatever comes to your mind'." "Sonam Kapoor took Rs 11 to act," Rakeysh had previously stated. Discussing 'Bhaag Milkha Bhaag', Akshay Kumar had earlier said, "I am very guilty of not doing [it]."

289.title: I don't fear anyone, no one needs to fear me: Shashi Tharoor
289.article_body: Congress MP Shashi Tharoor met senior leaders of IUML in Panakkad today and said that he fears no one and sees no reason for anyone to fear him. This comes at a time when Tharoor's Malabar tour is not appreciated by some leaders of the Congress party. Tharoor said that the controversy surrounding his tour was unnecessary.

290.title: Every 11 minutes, a woman or a girl is killed by intimate partner or family: UN chief
290.article_body: UN chief Antonio Guterres has stated that every 11 minutes, a woman or a girl is killed by an intimate partner or family member. "Violence against women and girls is the most pervasive human rights violation in the world," Guterres said, adding that other stresses, including COVID-19 pandemic and economic turmoil, lead to more physical and verbal abuse against women.

291.title: Respect our core interests, don't cross 'red line' on Taiwan: China to US
291.article_body: Chinese Defence Minister Wei Fenghe on Tuesday told US counterpart Lloyd Austin that Taiwan is at the core of China's core interests and was a "red line" that must not be crossed. The US must respect China's core interests and should adopt a rational, practical policy towards China and get relations between both countries back on track, Fenghe said.

292.title: 32-yr-old man shot dead in Ghaziabad after brawl at birthday party
292.article_body: A 32-year-old man was shot dead over some minor issue which occurred at a birthday party hosted by his neighbour in Indrapuri, the police said. The deceased man allegedly sought the number of a woman at the party after which an argument broke out. Further, the suspect woman and her accomplices were alleged to have opened fire at the man.

293.title: Met him in plane, was difficult as he was married with 2 kids: Neena on husband
293.article_body: Actress Neena Gupta said that she met her husband Vivek Mehra in a plane. "That was a very nice phase. It was difficult because he was already married with two children. It was a tough time for me, a very very tough time...that time has passed," she added. She also said she can do anything for her daughter Masaba Gupta.

294.title: China's JD.com to cut salaries of 2,000 managers by 10% to 20%
294.article_body: China's JD.com will cut the salaries of about 2,000 senior managers by 10% to 20% next year. It is also planning to allocate $1.4 billion for a fund to help its staff and those at recently-acquired courier firm Deppon Logistics with buying homes. JD's Founder Richard Liu will also personally donate $14 million to a fund for the employees' children.

295.title: Mumbai Anti Narcotics Cell seizes drugs worth ₹30 lakh, 2 arrested
295.article_body: The Bandra unit of the Mumbai Anti Narcotics Cell has arrested two drug suppliers from the Jogeshwari area and seized over 1 kg of charas, valued at over ₹30 lakh in the international market, from their possession, Mumbai Police said. A case has been registered under the NDPS Act. Further investigation is underway, Mumbai Police added.

296.title: ASI to probe video of man allegedly offering namaz at Taj Mahal
296.article_body: Archaeological Survey of India (ASI) will conduct an investigation into the authenticity of a viral video allegedly showing a man offering namaz in a garden said to be the premises of Taj Mahal. "None of [ASI staff] at Taj Mahal saw such happening. I was also present...on Sunday but came across no such incident," ASI Agra Circle Superintending Archaeologist said.

297.title: FTX, its execs, ex-CEO's parents bought $121-mn Bahamian properties: Report
297.article_body: Sam Bankman-Fried's FTX, his parents and senior executives of the firm bought at least 19 Bahamian properties worth nearly $121 million over the past two years, Reuters reported citing records. FTX Property Holdings bought 15 properties worth nearly $100 million. Its most expensive purchase was a $30-million penthouse at a resort where Tiger Woods hosts a golf tournament every year.

298.title: Missing Bengaluru techie, whose child was found dead, traced to TN
298.article_body: The missing Bengaluru techie, whose two-and-a-half-year-old daughter was found dead in a lake in Kolar district days ago, has been traced to Tamil Nadu's Vellore, said police officials. The man, Rahul Parmar, was traced after he called his father-in-law claiming that he was kidnapped and his daughter was taken away by unidentified people. The police are searching for him.

299.title: Report says Musk asked Twitter staff to send weekly update of their work, he reacts
299.article_body: In an internal memo to employees, Elon Musk has reportedly asked the staff to send a weekly email update of their work, wherein they must include what project are they working on or "code samples" and what they have been trying to accomplish. Responding to a tweet about this, Musk wrote, "Perhaps not unreasonable to know if anything was accomplished."

300.title: Quality of life important for development, not just economic index: Stalin
300.article_body: Tamil Nadu Chief Minister MK Stalin on Monday said that the development should not be determined on economic indicators alone, it should hinge on the quality of life and happiness index. Furthermore, he said, the state government has been striving with the noble objective of development for all and development in all sectors.

301.title: Texas to send armoured vehicles to US-Mexico border to 'repel' migrants
301.article_body: Texas will deploy military armoured personnel carriers along its border with Mexico to "repel" undocumented migrants trying to enter the US, authorities said. This comes a month before a COVID-19 health measure blocking asylum-seekers from entering the country ends, which may lead to a surge in asylum-seekers. Texas Governor Greg Abbott has said he'll treat illegal immigration like an 'invasion'.

302.title: 2 Estonians arrested for alleged role in $575 million crypto fraud
302.article_body: Two Estonian citizens have been arrested in the city of Tallinn for their alleged involvement in a $575 million cryptocurrency fraud, the US Justice Department said. Sergei Potapenko and Ivan Turõgin allegedly tricked hundreds of thousands of people into investing in a cryptocurrency bank called Polybius and buy contracts for a mining service HashFlare between 2015 and 2019, police said.

303.title: ₹36 cr sanctioned for development, construction at 125-yr-old Hyd market
303.article_body: Quli Qutub Shah Urban Development Authority has prepared a special plan to restore the glory of Hyderabad's Murgi Chowk Market which was built 125 years ago. Reports said ₹36 crore has been sanctioned for development and construction works in market area. The plan is also to construct a G+1 building with a restaurant on the first floor of the market.

304.title: Kajol's family didn't want her to act after marriage with Ajay: Suneel
304.article_body: Filmmaker Suneel Darshan shared that when Kajol was about to get married to Ajay Devgn, her mother Tanuja said that her family didn't want her to pursue her acting career at that moment. "She said, 'You know, she's getting married...they don't want her to pursue a career'," he recalled. Kajol was supposed to star in Suneel's directorial film 'Jaanwar'.

305.title: Suspect in Colorado shooting carried out hate crime: Colorado Mayor
305.article_body: The gunman, who attacked an LGBTQ nightclub in the US state of Colorado, is believed to have carried out a hate crime, Colorado Mayor John Suthers said. Anderson Aldrich is suspected of five counts of first-degree murder and five counts of bias-motivated crimes causing bodily injury, the Associated Press reported citing court records. Five people were killed in the attack.

306.title: I used to be one of them, I can see myself in them: Kartik on fans' attention
306.article_body: Actor Kartik Aaryan said that when he is surrounded by his fans at a theatre or any event, he can see himself in them. "I used to be one of them myself, so I know how earnest they are. I just love my fans and 'fanception' is a word that truly captures my love and emotion for them," he added.

307.title: Rashtrapati Bhavan to be open 5 days a week to public from Dec 1
307.article_body: The Rashtrapati Bhavan will be open to the public for five days a week instead of just two days from December 1, a spokesperson for the President said. Guided tours will be provided to the visitors between 10 am and 4 pm every Wednesday, Thursday, Friday, Saturday and Sunday, except on holidays.

308.title: Parts of Bengaluru to see scheduled power cuts till Thursday
308.article_body: Parts of Bengaluru will see scheduled power cuts from Tuesday to Thursday owing to certain projects scheduled by Bangalore Electricity Supply Company (BESCOM). On Tuesday, areas including Kuvempu Nagar and Huskur will be impacted, while on Wednesday, Hondada Circle, Jali Nagara and other areas will be affected. Places, including Mandipet and Mahaveer Road will be impacted on Thursday.

309.title: Pentagon Chief meets Chinese counterpart, discusses its 'dangerous behaviour'
309.article_body: US Defence Secretary Lloyd Austin held a meeting with his Chinese counterpart Wei Fenghe in Cambodia where he emphasised the need to improve crisis communication while raising concerns about "increasingly dangerous" behaviour by Chinese military aircraft. This was the leaders' first meeting since US House Speaker Nancy Pelosi visited Taiwan in August, a move that angered China.

310.title: The big favourites never win WC, details make champions: Argentina manager
310.article_body: Argentina manager Lionel Scaloni said the teams that are considered as "big favourites" for an edition of the FIFA World Cup "never" end up winning the tournament. "Details will make champions and not necessarily the team that plays the best," added Scaloni. "England [are] a candidate but I...[won't] say that the Arab teams are a step below," he stated.

311.title: FTX customer sues NBA champions Golden State Warriors over collapse
311.article_body: NBA champions Golden State Warriors were sued by an FTX customer who accused the former of fraudulently promoting the now-bankrupt cryptocurrency exchange. Other defendants include FTX Founder Sam Bankman-Fried and Caroline Ellison, who led FTX's trading firm Alameda Research. Elliott Lam accused the defendants of falsely representing that FTX was a "viable and safe way to invest in crypto".

312.title: Delhi Police allowed to conduct Aftab's polygraph test: Reports
312.article_body: A Delhi court on Tuesday allowed Delhi Police to conduct a polygraph test on Aftab Amin Poonawala, who is accused of murdering his live-in partner Shraddha Walkar in May, claimed reports. His police custody was also extended by four days today. His legal counsel said a narco test will be conducted soon. Aftab and Shraddha met through a dating app.

313.title: Dosti se zyada kuch nai hota: Russian envoy as he describes Indo-Russia relation
313.article_body: As India and Russia celebrated 75 years of diplomatic relations, Russian Ambassador to India Denis Alipov described the relationship between two nations in Hindi. "There is a popular saying in India, 'Dosti se zyada kuch bhi nahi hota.' A very precise characteristic of the trusted and friendly character of Russia-India strategic partnership," he said.

314.title: K'taka govt to fight legal battle over boundary dispute with Maharashtra
314.article_body: Karnataka government is set to fight a legal battle over a boundary dispute with Maharashtra in the Supreme Court. CM Basavaraj Bommai said that the state has formed a team of senior advocates to fight the case. "What has happened in Maharashtra is that the border dispute itself has become a political object," said Bommai.

315.title: 1,349 candidates to contest in upcoming MCD polls; majority are women
315.article_body: A total of 1,349 candidates will contest in the upcoming MCD elections, according to Delhi State Election Commission (DSEC). Out of the total candidates, 709 are women and 640 are men, who will contest for the post of councillors in 250 wards. AAP has 140 women candidates followed by BJP and Congress at 137 and 134 candidates, respectively.

316.title: Twitter hits another all-time high, adds 1.6 mn DAUs in a week: Musk
316.article_body: Twitter owner Elon Musk revealed on Monday that the platform has added 1.6 million daily active users (DAUs) in the past week. "Another all-time high," he added. Earlier, Musk shared that Twitter's usage was at an all-time high and shared graphs showing a surge in Twitter's monetizable daily active users globally and in the US.

317.title: Authorities suggest dismantling selfie point after car pileup on Pune highway
317.article_body: After 48 cars got piled up on the Pune-Bengaluru highway on Sunday, high officials of Pune Police, NHAI and PMC visited the spot on Monday. Later, the authorities proposed reducing the gradient of the slope on the Navale Bridge and the curvature of the highway by-pass to improve safety. Dismantling the selfie point next to the bridge was also suggested.

318.title: US Prez Biden pardons turkeys 'Chocolate' & 'Chip' for Thanksgiving
318.article_body: US President Joe Biden on Monday pardoned two Thanksgiving turkeys named Chocolate and Chip while cracking jokes about his political party's better-than-expected performance in this month's midterm elections. The large white birds, each weighing nearly 23 kg, were named after Joe Biden's favourite ice cream flavour. The White House turkey pardon is a tradition that dates back decades.

319.title: Pune police arrest sextortion case 'mastermind' from Rajasthan
319.article_body: The Pune City Police arrested the alleged "mastermind" behind several sextortion crimes in the country from Rajasthan's Alwar. The 29-year-old accused, Anwar Suban Khan, is involved in the case involving a 19-year-old youth from Pune, who died by suicide after being blackmailed by a "woman" with whom he came in contact through social media, police said.

320.title: David Warner smashes a hundred in international cricket after 1,042 days
320.article_body: Australia opener David Warner on Tuesday scored 106 runs off 102 deliveries against England in the third ODI in Melbourne. It is Warner's 19th hundred in ODI cricket. Further, it is his first hundred across formats in international cricket in 1,042 days. Warner slammed eight fours and two sixes in his knock.

321.title: 'Twitter may set up engineering team in India to decentralise things,' says Musk: Report
321.article_body: In a meeting with Twitter employees, Elon Musk reportedly suggested that it would be a good idea to "somewhat decentralise things" by setting up engineering teams in Japan, India, Indonesia, and Brazil. Musk also said that the company is done with layoffs and is actively hiring for roles in the engineering and sales department, the report added.

322.title: Largest book publisher Penguin scraps $2.2 bn merger deal with Simon & Schuster
322.article_body: World's largest book publisher Penguin Random House has scrapped a $2.2-billion deal to merge with smaller American rival Simon & Schuster. The development comes weeks after a US judge blocked the merger, saying it would "substantially" hurt competition for books in the publishing market. Notably, Penguin will pay a $200 million termination fee to Simon & Schuster's parent company Paramount.

323.title: Priyanka Gandhi to join 'Bharat Jodo Yatra' on Wednesday
323.article_body: Congress leader Jairam Ramesh has confirmed that party General Secretary Priyanka Gandhi will be participating in the 'Bharat Jodo Yatra' on Wednesday. He said that Tuesday is a rest day for the Yatra, which will resume on Wednesday. "Priyanka Gandhi will participate for four days," Jairam Ramesh tweeted in Hindi. The 'Bharat Jodo Yatra' will enter Madhya Pradesh tomorrow.

324.title: Beer maker Bira91 raises $70 million from Japan's Kirin Holdings
324.article_body: Beer maker Bira91 has secured $70 million in a Series D funding round led by Japanese beverage company, Kirin Holdings. After the funding round, Kirin's shareholding in the company reached 20% from 10%. Bira91 has so far raised over $200 million from investors including Sequoia Capital India, Sofina and Kirin Holdings. The beer maker was founded by Ankur Jain.

325.title: Kaynes Technology stock lists at 32% premium over IPO price
325.article_body: Electronics manufacturing company Kaynes Technology India's stock was listed at a 32% premium over its issue price of ₹587 on Tuesday. It started trading at ₹778/share on the NSE and ₹775/share on the BSE. The ₹858-crore IPO of the Mysuru-based company was subscribed 34.16 times during the November 10-14 period. Qualified institutional buyers bought shares 98.47 times the allotted quota.

326.title: Boman Irani avoided surgery and bounced back in 3 weeks: QI Spine
326.article_body: QI Spine shared that their treatment process combines the expertise of 300+ doctors backed by data intelligence to offer the most accurate diagnosis along with Digital Spine Analysis that helps identify weak muscles and treat them without surgery. In addition, they mentioned that their online Spine Health test also helps find the root cause of the problem.

327.title: Paytm shares hit new all-time low, stock trading 78% below IPO price
327.article_body: Shares of Paytm's parent company One97 Communications hit an all-time low of ₹483.30 as they declined by 10% on BSE Sensex in Tuesday’s intra-day trade. The stock previously touched a low of ₹511 on May 12. In the last year, Paytm's share price has dropped 64% and the stock is currently trading 78% below its IPO price of ₹2,150/share.

328.title: Kartik used to meet me often over teas in office: Anees on 'Bhool Bhulaiyaa 2'
328.article_body: Filmmaker Anees Bazmee said that actor Kartik Aaryan is great at making connections. "I remember how he used to meet me so often over teas at my office, while we were still writing 'Bhool Bhulaiyaa 2', so we both become comfortable with each other and understand our tuning," he said, adding that Aaryan is very hard-working.

329.title: India announce playing XI for their last T20I of the year against New Zealand
329.article_body: New Zealand stand-in captain Tim Southee won the toss and elected to bat first against India in the third T20I in Napier. India have made one change to their playing XI, with Harshal Patel replacing Washington Sundar. The match is India's last T20I of 2022. India lead the three-match series 1-0.

330.title: Why doubt Delhi Police: HC as it dismisses plea for CBI probe into Shraddha case
330.article_body: The Delhi High Court on Tuesday dismissed with costs a PIL that sought to transfer the probe of the Shraddha Walkar murder case from Delhi Police to CBI. "Why should we doubt Delhi Police?" HC remarked. It also called the plea a 'publicity interest litigation'. The petitioner claimed investigation details were revealed to the media, which isn't permissible by law.

331.title: PM Modi distributes 71,056 appointment letters at Rozgar Mela
331.article_body: PM Narendra Modi on Tuesday distributed 71,056 appointment letters to new recruits at the Rozgar Mela, saying, "You are getting this new responsibility in a special era. The country has entered Amrit Kaal." He added that youths are the biggest strength of India. The PM also launched the Karmayogi Prarambh module, an online orientation course for all new appointees.

332.title: More than 30 TMC MLAs in contact with our party: Bengal BJP leader
332.article_body: West Bengal BJP MLA Agnimitra Paul claimed that Trinamool Congress government led by Mamata Banerjee will collapse soon. Paul said that more than 30 TMC MLAs are in contact with BJP in the state. "There will be a khela here in December...They know that their government will not continue for long after December. Their existence is at stake," she added.

333.title: A British girl cried, said 'Why did you beat SRK so much in Baazigar?': Dalip
333.article_body: Recalling his experience while interacting with a British girl, actor Dalip Tahil said, "She was visibly agitated upon seeing me...[and] asked, 'Why did you beat Shah Rukh Khan so much in Baazigar?’. I was taken aback!" "She even had tears in her eyes. I asked her...'Didn't he beat me as well?' She replied, 'That is okay'," added Dalip.

334.title: BJP uses 'vanvasi' for tribals as it doesn't want them in cities: Rahul
334.article_body: Ahead of the Gujarat Assembly elections, Congress leader Rahul Gandhi criticised the BJP, alleging that the party uses the term "vanvasi" for tribals because it does not want them in cities. "[They do not want to] see your children becoming engineers, doctors...speak English…In another five or 10 years, all the jungles will be in the hands of...industrialists," said Rahul.

335.title: Musk says there are no plans to move Twitter's HQ to Texas: Report
335.article_body: Elon Musk has told Twitter employees that there are "no plans" to move the firm's headquarters to Texas, The Verge reported citing recordings. However, he added it could make sense to be "dual-headquartered" in California and Texas. Musk also said moving the headquarters to Texas "would play into the idea that Twitter has gone from being left-wing to right-wing".

336.title: Was hoping he would run for US President: Netflix CEO on Disney CEO
336.article_body: Netflix CEO Reed Hastings reacted to Bob Iger being named Disney’s new CEO, saying, “Ugh. I had been hoping Iger would run for President. He is amazing.” Iger held the role of Disney’s CEO for 15 years before retiring from the firm 11 months ago. He will now serve in the role for two years.

337.title: Men's health startup Bonatra raises ₹5.5 crore in pre-seed funding
337.article_body: Wellness startup Bonatra﻿, which deals with andropause, has raised ₹5.5 crore in a pre-seed round led by ITI Growth Opportunities Fund. The doctor-led IoMT startup was founded by Rahul Kishore Singh, Manjari Chandra, Ramanpreet Singh and Amit Acharya in March 2022. NestAway and Helloworld Founder Jitendra Jagadev and BlackBuck Founder Rajesh Yabaji, among others, participated in the round.

338.title: JioCinema trolled as fans face issues streaming FIFA World Cup, company apologises
338.article_body: JioCinema was trolled online after people faced buffering issues during the live-streaming of the inaugural FIFA World Cup match on its app. "Can't even watch 1 min...Very disappointed," wrote a Twitter user, while another called it "worst viewing experience ever". Taking to Twitter, JioCinema apologised for "any inconvenience" faced by users and said it is working on fixing the issue.

339.title: Player who scored USA's first 2022 FIFA WC goal is Liberia President George Weah's son
339.article_body: Forward Tim Weah, who scored USA's first goal in 2022 FIFA World Cup, is Liberia President George Weah's son. George was himself a footballer and was the first African to win Ballon d'Or. George played for clubs like Monaco, PSG, AC Milan, Chelsea and Manchester City. Tim, 22, was born in USA and plays club football for Lille in France.

340.title: COVID-19 cases hit record high in Beijing; parks & museums closed
340.article_body: Beijing on Tuesday shut parks, shopping malls and museums as the Chinese capital recorded its highest rise in daily coronavirus cases. Beijing reported 1,438 new local cases on Tuesday, up from 962 on Sunday. Beijing has also tightened rules for entering the city, requiring people arriving from elsewhere in the country to undergo three days of COVID-19 testing.

341.title: Dignity of Guv's post has ended in Maharashtra: Sanjay Raut
341.article_body: Shiv Sena leader Sanjay Raut on Tuesday said a Governor is neutral and shows dignity in his words and conduct. His statement came following Maharashtra Governor Bhagat Singh Koshyari's remarks on Chhatrapati Shivaji Maharaj. "The dignity of the post of Governor has ended in Maharashtra because BJP has made the Raj Bhavan its party headquarters," Raut added.

342.title: Satyendar Jain moves Delhi court demanding dry fruits, dates in jail
342.article_body: Jailed AAP leader Satyendar Jain has moved a Delhi court demanding food items as per his religious beliefs, including dry fruits, mixed seeds, fruits and dates. The plea said that Jain is on a religious fast for the last six months and such food items are necessary for his nourishment and survival.

343.title: Man in touch with Mangaluru blast accused picked up from B'luru
343.article_body: A man who was allegedly in touch with the main accused in Mangaluru autorickshaw blast case was picked up by police from Bengaluru on Monday. He was sent to his native place Mysuru as police needed to take him to different areas for investigation, an official said. Meanwhile, another person was detained in Tamil Nadu's Nilgiris and brought to Karnataka.

344.title: Punjab grants ₹38.53 crore to set up toy libraries in govt schools
344.article_body: Punjab government has released a grant of ₹38.53 crore for setting up toy libraries for pre-primary students at government schools across the state. The grant has been issued to impart education through modern tools in 12,846 schools, state School Education Minister Harjot Singh Bains said. He added that it can be used to teach students about health care, cleanliness, etc.

345.title: 4 students arrested for torturing, killing pregnant stray dog in Delhi
345.article_body: Four students of South East Delhi's Don Bosco Technical Institute were arrested for allegedly beating a pregnant dog to death in the New Friends Colony area. Police registered a case after a purported video of the incident, showing a group of men thrashing the dog and later dragging her across the field, was widely circulated on social media.

346.title: Whatever mistake I made was in the heat of the moment: Aftab to court in Shraddha case
346.article_body: Aftab Amin Poonawala, who is arrested for the murder of his live-in partner Shraddha Walkar, on Tuesday told a court in Delhi that "whatever mistake I made was in the heat of the moment". He also told the court that he is cooperating in the investigation. He further told the court that he is having difficulty in recalling the incident.

347.title: Told Vivian 'If you don't want the child, I won't have it': Neena on pregnancy
347.article_body: Recalling the conversation over her pregnancy with ex-West Indies cricketer Vivian Richards who was in a relationship with her, actress Neena Gupta said, "I...[told] him that if you don't want this child, then I won't have it."
