"Everyone told me, 'How can you do it alone?' because he was...married," added Neena. Neena decided to give birth to her daughter Masaba.

348.title: Zoom shares plunge after company cuts annual revenue forecast
348.article_body: Zoom Video Communications' Nasdaq-listed shares plunged over 6% in extended trading after the California-based company cut its annual revenue forecast on Monday. Zoom now expects to generate up to $4.38 billion in annual revenue, compared with an earlier outlook of up to $4.40 billion, as its online business declines. Meanwhile, the firm's third-quarter revenue rose 5% to $1.1 billion.

349.title: 2 buses set on fire in South Africa's Cape Town during taxi strike
349.article_body: Two buses were set on fire in South Africa's Cape Town as local taxi associations began a two-day strike against termination of an incentive program. The Western Cape provincial government announced termination of the scheme, that encouraged safe driving practises and curtailed illegal operations, due to lack of funding. The scheme was cancelled after a little more than a year.

350.title: I admire Kohli, but Surya is someone I'd strive to be like: NZ's Finn Allen
350.article_body: New Zealand opener Finn Allen, during an interview, said that he admires Virat Kohli but would strive to be like Suryakumar Yadav. "I really love watching Suryakumar play...Some of the shots he plays are out of this world," he stated. Finn, who has played 24 T20Is so far, was dismissed for a duck in the second T20I against India.

351.title: Twitter to soon encrypt DMs and add video, voice chat: Report
351.article_body: In a meeting with Twitter employees, CEO Elon Musk said that the company would soon encrypt direct messages (DMs) and work to add encrypted video and voice calling between accounts, The Verge reported. Musk also added that "we also want to have the ability to do voice and video chat via DMs," according to the report.

352.title: One more suspected death of child due to measles in Mumbai, toll rises to 9
352.article_body: One more child is suspected to have died due to measles in Mumbai, taking the death toll to nine since October 26. A 15-month-old girl died due to the infection on November 19. "Mumbai has reported nine measles deaths, of which one is suspected and will be reviewed by the committee," said a BMC official.

353.title: Mohali policewoman caught taking ₹20,000 bribe from rape victim
353.article_body: A woman Assistant Sub-inspector (ASI) posted in Mohali, identified as Parveen Kaur, allegedly took a bribe of ₹20,000 from a rape victim for arresting the accused. The act was caught in the CCTV cameras installed in the victim's house. The footage surfaced on social media, after which the policewoman was booked under the Prevention of Corruption Act.

354.title: Andhra woman delivers baby on road after hospital denies admission
354.article_body: A woman delivered a baby on the road in Andhra Pradesh's Tirupati after a hospital allegedly denied to admit her as no one was accompanying her. A video of the incident which purportedly shows the woman delivering the baby while people hold a bedsheet over her has surfaced online. A primary healthcare worker had reportedly helped the woman.

355.title: Arrests being made without reason, burdens judiciary: Ex-CJI Lalit
355.article_body: Former Chief Justice of India UU Lalit said that in recent times, arrests are being made without a reason and civil disputes are being projected as criminal matters. "This puts a burden on the judicial system," he said at a Bombay High Court event. He added that 80% of Indian prisoners are undertrials, while the conviction rate is 27%.

356.title: Ajay's Bholaa to have 3 instalments, Salman to star in sequel: Report
356.article_body: Ajay Devgn's upcoming film 'Bholaa' will reportedly be made into a franchise with three instalment films. The sequel will reportedly star Salman Khan. As per a report, Salman will play a crucial role alongside Ajay Devgn. "The second and third part will not necessarily be titled 'Bholaa', but will be set in the same universe," a source told Mid-day.

357.title: India reports 294 new COVID-19 cases, active cases stand at 6,209
357.article_body: India reported 294 new COVID-19 cases in the last 24 hours, according to the Ministry of Health and Family Welfare. This comes a day after the country reported 406 fresh cases. The number of active COVID-19 cases in India stands at 6,209. The death toll in the country so far has reached 5,30,591, according to the ministry.

358.title: Pic of Earth's view from Moon released by NASA
358.article_body: NASA has released a picture of the Earth clicked by its Orion Spacecraft that has completed its closest fly-by of the Moon. "Orion Spacecraft completed its closest fly-by of the Moon...81 miles above the lunar surface, traveling 5,102 mph," NASA said. Orion will enter distant retrograde orbit beyond the Moon on Friday, the space agency stated.

359.title: No one knew anything about me, can't count rejections I faced: Aamir's niece
359.article_body: Actor Aamir Khan's niece Zayn Marie Khan said that she can't even count the number of rejections she has faced in the industry. "I was trying to come into this career on my own...I do have a family that I am related to, and a lot of times when I went to audition nobody knew anything about me," she added.

360.title: Dell's operating income in Q3 jumps 68% to $1.8 bn, revenue falls 6%
360.article_body: Dell on Monday said its operating income jumped 68% to record $1.8 billion in the third quarter of fiscal 2023 as demand for servers climbed and easing supply-chain pressures helped reduce costs. The company's total revenue dropped 6% to $24.72 billion in the quarter. Net income fell 93% to $241 million due to a $1 billion settlement of a lawsuit.

361.title: Man falls from cliff while taking selfies, dies in Faridabad
361.article_body: A 42-year-old man has died after he fell down 200 feet from a cliff while taking selfies in the forest area of the Aravallis in Faridabad, police said. The body was recovered on Sunday following an overnight rescue operation, police added. "At the cliff, [the deceased] had also spoken to his wife over a video call," an SHO said.

362.title: 14-yr-old girl raped, murdered in France, 31-yr-old suspect arrested
362.article_body: A 14-year-old girl in southern France has been raped and murdered, police said. A 31-year-old man has been arrested who allegedly forced the girl into his car after she left school in the town of Tonneins. Her body was found in an abandoned house. The murder comes weeks after a 12-year-old girl was raped and killed in Paris.

363.title: Israel's Netanyahu wins defamation case against ex-PM Ehud Olmert
363.article_body: Israeli Prime Minister-designate Benjamin Netanyahu on Monday won a defamation lawsuit against ex-PM Ehud Olmert. He had sued Olmert after the latter alleged that Netanyahu, his wife Sara, and son Yair all suffered from "mental illness". Olmert became PM in 2006 but stepped down in 2009 as he faced corruption allegations. He was replaced by Netanyahu that year.

364.title: Pak intruder killed by BSF along border in Jammu, another arrested
364.article_body: A BSF official said that an intruder coming from Pakistan was neutralised around 2:30 am on Tuesday along the international India-Pakistan border in Jammu. The official added he continued approaching the fence even after warnings from BSF. Meanwhile, another intruder was apprehended in the Ramgarh sector of J&K. "Nothing incriminating was found from him," BSF said.

365.title: EV startup Faraday Future doubts if it'll continue operating over 2023
365.article_body: EV startup Faraday Future has raised "substantial doubt" on whether it would be able to continue operating over the next year, filings revealed. It's also uncertain when it will dispatch the first deliveries of FF 91 luxury EVs. The startup's stock has plunged about 94% so far this year. It closed out the third quarter with $31.76 million in cash.

366.title: I would like to be the one to give a checkmate against Messi: Ronaldo
366.article_body: In a press conference, Portugal captain Cristiano Ronaldo said he'd like to be the one to give a checkmate against Argentina captain Lionel Messi. "Let’s see. It'd be beautiful [to win 2022 FIFA World Cup]...As it happened in chess, it'd be magic to happen in football as well," he stated. Portugal’s first group match is against Ghana on Thursday.

367.title: We are still hiring: TikTok CEO amid layoffs by major tech companies
367.article_body: TikTok CEO Shou Zi Chew at a recent event said the China-based social media company is still hiring, but at a measured pace. The statement comes as major tech companies including Meta, Amazon and Twitter have laid off staff in the recent weeks. TikTok is currently in the middle of a three-year hiring push to add about 3,000 engineers worldwide.

368.title: Man seen massaging Satyendar Jain in Tihar jail in viral video is rape accused: Report
368.article_body: The man giving massage to jailed Delhi minister Satyendar Jain in a viral video is Rinku, a prisoner in a rape case, charged under POCSO Act and IPC sections 376, 506 and 509, ANI reported quoting Tihar Jail official sources. He's not a physiotherapist, officials told ANI. This comes after AAP claimed Jain was receiving physiotherapy for a spinal injury.

369.title: Delhi Police moves court for conducting polygraph test on Aftab
369.article_body: Delhi Police has moved a court seeking permission for conducting the polygraph test on Aftab Poonawala, accused of murdering his live-in partner Shraddha Walkar and chopping her body into 35 pieces. Police had earlier told the court that Aftab is giving wrong information and misleading the investigation. Last week, the court allowed police to conduct a narco-analysis test on Aftab.

370.title: Got asthma attack when SRK was about to die in 'Kal Ho…': Mismatched actor
370.article_body: 'Mismatched' actor Abhinav Sharma recalled that at the age of 13-14, when he was watching 'Kal Ho Naa Ho', he got "an asthma attack when Shah Rukh Khan was about to die". He remembered that he and his family missed the ending of the film, which had upset his mother. The actor also spoke about his affection for Shah Rukh.

371.title: As a human, I'd like Argentina to lose all WC matches: Messi's ex-doctor
371.article_body: Argentina captain Lionel Messi's former doctor Diego Schwarzstein said he'd like to see Argentina lose every match in the 2022 FIFA World Cup and get eliminated in the first round, as a "human being". "Why? I am convinced that this obscenely populist government that we have here would use the success of Argentina...to cover things up," added Schwarzstein.

372.title: Social media commentator arrested for comments against MK Stalin
372.article_body: Tamil Nadu Police arrested a political commentator, Kishore Swamy, for allegedly putting out tweets against CM MK Stalin on Chennai rain situation. He was arrested after his anticipatory bail plea was dismissed by the sessions court. "We sent him four notices but he failed to respond. We took him into our custody from Puducherry on Monday," a police officer said.

373.title: GHMC to establish 16 more multi-purpose function halls in Hyderabad
373.article_body: The Greater Hyderabad Municipal Corporation (GHMC) has proposed to establish 16 more multi-purpose function halls in Hyderabad in addition to the existing list of nine taking the total number to 25. The total 25 function halls will cost ₹95.70 crore. These function halls will have all facilities needed for weddings like separate rooms for brides and grooms, dining area etc.

374.title: Kanye West says he's selling Adidas, Gap hoodies for $20 after firms cut ties with him
374.article_body: Giving a tour of his Los Angeles workshop, rapper Kanye West said he'll be selling hoodies from Balenciaga, Adidas, and Gap for $20. These fashion brands had cut ties with the rapper following his antisemitic comments. In the tour video, many clothes were seen labelled "Ye24", as West also confirmed his intention to run for the 2024 presidential race.

375.title: Delhi court extends Aftab Poonawala's police custody by 4 days
375.article_body: The Saket court in Delhi extended the police custody of Aftab Amin Poonawala by four days on Tuesday. Aftab is accused of murdering his live-in partner Shraddha Walkar in May and cutting her body into pieces. He was produced before the court in a special hearing and reportedly told the court that the incident happened in heat of the moment.

376.title: TV is like comfort food, will never go out of fashion: Rupali Ganguly
376.article_body: 'Anupamaa' actress Rupali Ganguly said she hasn't "understood" the OTT world and called television similar to "comfort food". She said television will never go out of fashion because unlike some of the content on OTT space, TV can be watched with family members without feeling embarrassed. "A large chunk of our population...still not gone into the OTT zone," she said.

377.title: Nykaa stock falls over 3% after Lighthouse India stake sale report
377.article_body: The shares of Nykaa parent FSN E-Commerce Ventures Limited fell over 3% on Tuesday after reports of nearly 1.8 crore shares worth ₹320 crore changing hands in a block deal. Private equity firm Lighthouse India has reportedly sold the shares at a price of around ₹183.5 apiece. The shares amount to nearly 0.65% of Nykaa's overall stake.

378.title: Income Tax Dept raids several places linked to Telangana Labour Minister Malla Reddy
378.article_body: The Income Tax Department on Tuesday conducted raids at various locations belonging to the Telangana Labour Minister Chamakura Malla Reddy and his associates for alleged tax evasion. Reports said that searches are underway at several places in Rangareddy district of Hyderabad. Raids are also being conducted at locations linked to Reddy's son and son-in-law, Times Now reported.

379.title: Air India looking to hire foreign pilots for wide-body planes: Report
379.article_body: Air India plans to hire foreign pilots for its wide-body Boeing 777 planes amid a shortage of pilots as the airline is looking to expand its fleet as well as international operations, PTI reported citing sources. The Tata Group-owned airline has reportedly approached various agencies that provide expat flight crew as it looks to rope in around 100 pilots.

380.title: Farmers hit by rains shouldn't be forced to repay power bills: Maha Dy CM
380.article_body: Maharashtra Deputy CM Devendra Fadnavis said on Monday that he has ordered officials of the Maharashtra State Electricity Distribution Company Limited (MSEDCL) to not force farmers to repay power bills, especially those who have lost their crops due to excess rains. "However, officials have been asked to collect the electricity bills from farmers for the current season only," he added.

381.title: Kanye tweets 'Shalom', Israel reacts; Musk says 'More countries should tweet like this'
381.article_body: Kanye West, who was banned from Twitter over anti-Semitic remarks, tweeted, "Shalom" on his return, to which Israel responded, "We'd very much like to be excluded from this narrative." Israel's response was a reference to Taylor Swift's statement after Kanye released 'Famous', wherein he calls her 'b***h'. Elon Musk tweeted, "Your tweets are good! More countries should tweet like this."

382.title: 72 kg of narcotics, drugs seized by authorities ahead of MCD polls
382.article_body: Ahead of the municipal polls in Delhi, authorities enforcing the model code of conduct have seized 72 kg of narcotics and drugs, officials said on Monday. "Also, 2,738 bottles of illegal liquor were seized, taking the cumulative figure to 96,085," an official statement read. MCD polls are due on December 4.

383.title: Live classes lead to hands-on learning: Scaler
383.article_body: Instructor-led live classes create an active learning environment vs self-study done online through pre-recorded lectures, said Scaler. It helps learners understand complex concepts more clearly, resolve doubts, interact with peers and apply learning in real time, Scaler shared. This combined with real-world case studies makes them become one of the most valued tech talents in the world, it added.

384.title: I'm perfectly fine, sustained minor injuries: 'Taarak...' actor Amit
384.article_body: 'Taarak Mehta Ka Ooltah Chashmah' actor Amit Bhatt, who recently got injured on the sets of the television show, has said that he's "perfectly fine". "All the claims suggesting that I have met with a tragic accident are false," he said, adding that he sustained "very minor injuries". He shared his health update on his Instagram profile.

385.title: Pune to get 2 new crematoriums for pet, stray and zoo animals
385.article_body: The Pune Municipal Corporation (PMC) has decided to set up two new crematoriums for pet, stray and zoo animals, in addition to the existing one. "We have identified two places - one at the Katraj zoo and the other at Bavdhan," said an official. "The PMC is providing the land while the state government is funding the crematoriums," he added.

386.title: Else can break hearts: HC as it allows marriage hall to host functions
386.article_body: The Nagpur bench of Bombay HC recently protected a marriage hall from action by Maharashtra Pollution Control Board (MPCB), saying that if scheduled functions don't take place at the venue, it can break the hearts of the bride and groom. The hall was under the scanner for not complying with rules. MPCB was asked to restore electricity and water supply.

387.title: 8 killed as small plane crashes into residential area in Colombia
387.article_body: A small plane carrying eight people crashed into a residential area of Colombia's second-largest city Medellin on Monday, killing all on board, authorities said. The aircraft had reportedly hit at least one house in the Belen Rosales area. The plane took off from the Olaya Herrera Airport in the morning and had reported an engine failure before crashing.

388.title: I was screaming, I said 'Can you please get my wife?': Glenn Maxwell on breaking leg
388.article_body: Recalling the moment he broke his leg during a friend's 50th birthday party, Australia all-rounder Glenn Maxwell said, "I heard and felt every part of it." He added, "I was screaming a bit and [my friend] was like, 'Please tell me you're joking'." Maxwell stated, "I said, 'I'm pretty sure both the bones are broken...Can you please get my wife?'"

389.title: How much compensation will Bob Iger receive as Disney CEO?
389.article_body: Bob Iger, who has been named as CEO of The Walt Disney Company for next two years, will receive about $27 million annually as compensation. Iger will receive a base salary of $1 million and a bonus equal to that amount, the company said. In addition, he will receive stock awards with a target value of $25 million each year.

390.title: Mumbai's trans-harbour line to get one more station next year
390.article_body: The trans-harbour railway line that runs between Thane and Panvel will have a new station, Digha, which will be a part of this route in January next year, a Mumbai Railway Vikas Corporation (MRVC) official said. The new station will come after Airoli and will also be part of the proposed Airoli-Kalwa elevated suburban corridor on the Central Railway line.

391.title: Bowl to the other guy: Ross Taylor on how to stop Suryakumar from scoring
391.article_body: Ex-New Zealand captain Ross Taylor, on being asked how New Zealand bowlers can stop Suryakumar Yadav from scoring, said, "Bowl to the other guy as much as you can." He added, "Suryakumar was hitting sixes at the MCG...if he hits it like that at McLean Park, they will be out of the ground." Suryakumar scored century in second NZ T20I.

392.title: Voters in Maha border districts get 1-day paid leave for Guj polls
392.article_body: The Maharashtra government has issued a government resolution allowing one-day paid leave for voters in border districts, like Palghar, Nashik, Nandurbar and Dhule, for Gujarat Assembly elections. "All private companies are instructed to follow this. If the order is violated, action will be taken," it said. Elections will be held in Gujarat in two phases on December 1 and 5.

393.title: 19 trains cancelled, 20 diverted after train derailment in Odisha
393.article_body: The Indian Railways cancelled 19 trains and diverted 20 others after a goods train derailed at Korai railway station in Odisha on Monday. In addition, six trains were partially cancelled. Three people were killed and four injured in the incident. The Railways arranged free road transportation for stranded passengers at Haridaspur station.

394.title: Rainbow-coloured bucket hats of female Wales fans confiscated at Qatar World Cup
394.article_body: A video has surfaced online showing pro-LGBTQ rainbow-coloured bucket hats of female Wales fans being confiscated upon their entry into the stadium for Wales-USA's 2022 FIFA World Cup match in Qatar. The Football Association of Wales is investigating the matter. "It's a shame," Wales manager Rob Page said.

395.title: World's richest man Musk's wealth drops by over $100 billion for 1st time
395.article_body: The world's richest man Elon Musk’s wealth declined by over $100 billion for the first time in 2022 as Tesla shares dropped to the lowest level since November 2020. Currently, Tesla CEO Musk's net worth stands at $170 billion as per the Bloomberg Billionaires Index, after peaking at $340 billion a little more than a year ago.

396.title: No plans to file for bankruptcy imminently: Crypto lender Genesis
396.article_body: Days after being forced to suspend customer redemptions following FTX's collapse, cryptocurrency lender Genesis said it has no plans to file for bankruptcy as it continues to have conversations with creditors. "We have no plans to file [for] bankruptcy imminently. Our goal is to resolve the current situation consensually without the need for any bankruptcy filing," a spokesperson said.

397.title: Brazil have 10 dances ready for each match: Raphinha on celebrating goals
397.article_body: Discussing his team's plans with regard to celebrating goals, Brazil and Barcelona footballer Raphinha said, "We already have dances prepared...till the 10th goal." "We have...10 dances prepared for each match...If we score more than 10...we will have to start innovating," added Raphinha. Brazil will face Serbia in their opening match of the 2022 FIFA World Cup.

398.title: BJP's allegations against AAP won't impact MCD polls: Atishi
398.article_body: AAP's Atishi said BJP’s corruption charge against her party won't impact voters in the Delhi civic polls. On being asked about the impact of BJP’s allegation that CM Arvind Kejriwal-led AAP was shielding Delhi ministers Manish Sisodia and Satyendar Jain, Atishi said, "Voters know the truth, they're not fools. The allegations levelled by BJP are not going to impact them."

399.title: Factory fire kills 36 in China; 'criminal suspects' arrested
399.article_body: At least 36 people have been killed and two others are missing after a fire broke out at a plant of a trading firm in central China, local authorities said on Tuesday. The fire, which started on Monday afternoon, took four hours to extinguish. "Criminal suspects" had been taken into custody in connection with the fire, authorities added.

400.title: Varun doesn't say bye on call, he says 'I'll call back'; call never comes: Kriti
400.article_body: Actress Kriti Sanon said that actor Varun Dhawan does not say bye on call. "[He] only [says] 'Okay I'll just call you back haan'. And the call never comes! It's a very detached conversation at the beginning and the end. Like, sometimes, he won't say bye and he will just vanish," she added.
